Question Analysis

Question #2791
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A contains one medium black square and a medium blue square. It also contains one big blue triangle and one small blue square. Below the small blue...
1 issue
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A contains one medium black square and a medium blue square. It also contains one big blue triangle and one small blue square. Below the small blue square there is the medium blue square. Above, to the left of and near to the medium black square which is to the right of and below the small blue square is the big blue triangle. Then, we have block B with a small yellow square, a big blue circle and a medium black triangle in it. This block also contains a small yellow triangle. To the right of the small yellow square which is above the big blue circle and the medium black triangle there is the small yellow triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of the medium black triangle there is a medium black circle. Block C is to the right of block B and below block A. It has two small yellow circles and two other medium yellow circles. Small yellow circle number one is above small yellow circle number two. Medium yellow circle number one is to the left of, above and near to medium yellow circle number two. It is to the right of small yellow circle number two. Below and to the left of medium yellow circle number one is small yellow circle number one. What is to the right of the medium black circle? a small yellow circle number two or a small yellow circle number one? (a) small yellow circle number two (b) small yellow circle number one (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block B contains a medium black triangle touching the bottom edge, and to its right is a medium black circle. Block C, to the right of Block B, contains two small yellow circles (number one above number two) and two medium yellow circles. Since Block C is directly to the right of Block B, the objects to the right of the medium black circle are the contents of Block C, which include both small yellow circle number one and small yellow circle number two. Answer: {C}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in Block C but makes an unsupported assumption about the spatial relationship between the medium black circle (in B) and the contents of Block C, leading to a conclusion that might be factually unsupported by the strict spatial constraints given.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context medium
Statement
Since Block C is directly to the right of Block B, the objects to the right of the medium black circle are the contents of Block C, which include both small yellow circle number one and small yellow circle number two.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes that the medium black circle (which is to the right of the medium black triangle in Block B) is immediately adjacent to Block C such that Block C's contents are 'to the right' of it. The context only states that Block C is to the right of Block B. It does not specify the exact horizontal position of the medium black circle relative to the boundary between B and C, nor does it state that the contents of C are immediately to the right of the medium black circle.
Answer Span:
Since Block C is directly to the right of Block B, the objects to the right of the medium black circle are the contents of Block C, which include both small yellow circle number one and small yellow circle number two.
Reference/Question Span:
Block C is to the right of block B
Question #2792
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A contains one medium black square and a medium blue square. It also contains one big blue triangle and one small blue square. Below the small blue...
Clean
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A contains one medium black square and a medium blue square. It also contains one big blue triangle and one small blue square. Below the small blue square there is the medium blue square. Above, to the left of and near to the medium black square which is to the right of and below the small blue square is the big blue triangle. Then, we have block B with a small yellow square, a big blue circle and a medium black triangle in it. This block also contains a small yellow triangle. To the right of the small yellow square which is above the big blue circle and the medium black triangle there is the small yellow triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of the medium black triangle there is a medium black circle. Block C is to the right of block B and below block A. It has two small yellow circles and two other medium yellow circles. Small yellow circle number one is above small yellow circle number two. Medium yellow circle number one is to the left of, above and near to medium yellow circle number two. It is to the right of small yellow circle number two. Below and to the left of medium yellow circle number one is small yellow circle number one. Which object is above a small yellow circle? the medium black circle or the big blue triangle? (a) the medium black circle (b) the big blue triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A contains a big blue triangle, and Block C (below Block A) contains two small yellow circles. Since Block C is below Block A, the big blue triangle is above the small yellow circles. The medium black circle is in Block B, which is separate from Blocks A and C. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies that the big blue triangle in Block A is above the small yellow circles in Block C, which is below Block A. It correctly notes the medium black circle is in Block B, separate from the relevant objects in A and C. The conclusion follows logically from the context provided.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #3270
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block C is to the left of A and block A is to the left of B. Block A contains a big blue square, one big black circle and one big yellow circle. To t...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block C is to the left of A and block A is to the left of B. Block A contains a big blue square, one big black circle and one big yellow circle. To the left of, above and near to the big black circle which is far from and below a medium yellow circle is the big blue square. The big black circle is touching the right edge of this block. Block B contains two medium blue squares. Above medium blue square number two is medium blue square number one. Medium blue square number two is to the right of a small yellow square and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the left edge of this block. Medium blue square number two is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a medium black square. And block C has a big blue triangle, one medium black square and one small black triangle. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of and below the small black triangle. The big blue triangle is to the right of the small black triangle. It is above the black shape which is to the right of the small black triangle. Which object is to the right of a small black triangle? the square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the triangle which is touching the left edge of a block? (a) the square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the triangle which is touching the left edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block C contains a small black triangle. The medium black square is to the right of and below the small black triangle, touching the bottom edge of Block C. The big blue triangle is also to the right of the small black triangle, above the medium black square. The medium yellow triangle is in Block B and is not related to the objects in Block C. Therefore, only the square touching the bottom edge of a block (the medium black square) is to the right of the small black triangle. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects to the right of the small black triangle based on the context provided for Block C.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #3269
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block C is to the left of A and block A is to the left of B. Block A contains a big blue square, one big black circle and one big yellow circle. To t...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block C is to the left of A and block A is to the left of B. Block A contains a big blue square, one big black circle and one big yellow circle. To the left of, above and near to the big black circle which is far from and below a medium yellow circle is the big blue square. The big black circle is touching the right edge of this block. Block B contains two medium blue squares. Above medium blue square number two is medium blue square number one. Medium blue square number two is to the right of a small yellow square and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the left edge of this block. Medium blue square number two is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a medium black square. And block C has a big blue triangle, one medium black square and one small black triangle. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of and below the small black triangle. The big blue triangle is to the right of the small black triangle. It is above the black shape which is to the right of the small black triangle. What is to the right of the small black triangle? a object which is touching the bottom edge of a block or a triangle that is touching the left edge of a block? (a) object which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) triangle that is touching the left edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block C contains the small black triangle. In the same block, the medium black square is to the right of and below the small black triangle, and the big blue triangle is to the right of the small black triangle and above the medium black square. Block B contains a medium yellow triangle touching the left edge. Neither the medium black square (which is in Block C) nor the medium yellow triangle (which is in Block B) is to the right of the small black triangle in Block C. The big blue triangle, which is in Block C, is to the right of the small black triangle. Answer: {D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain contains a direct contradiction regarding the position of the medium black square relative to the small black triangle, stating it is NOT to the right when the context explicitly says it IS to the right. This error fundamentally undermines the subsequent steps needed to answer the question.

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction low
Statement
Block B contains a medium yellow triangle touching the left edge.
Explanation
The context states that the medium yellow triangle is in Block B, but it is described as being to the left of medium blue square number two, not explicitly stated as touching the left edge of Block B. The context states: 'Medium blue square number two is to the right of a small yellow square and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the left edge of this block.' The 'this block' refers to Block B, as the preceding sentence discusses Block B's contents (medium blue squares). However, the reasoning chain implies the medium yellow triangle is *in* Block B, which is true, but the specific claim about it touching the left edge is only mentioned in relation to Block B's contents, and the reasoning chain uses this to compare it against an object in Block C.
Answer Span:
Block B contains a medium yellow triangle touching the left edge.
Reference/Question Span:
Medium blue square number two is to the right of a small yellow square and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the left edge of this block.
missing_context high
Statement
Neither the medium black square (which is in Block C) nor the medium yellow triangle (which is in Block B) is to the right of the small black triangle.
Explanation
The reasoning chain incorrectly concludes that the medium black square is not to the right of the small black triangle. The context explicitly states: 'It [the medium black square] is to the right of and below the small black triangle.' The reasoning chain contradicts this fact.
Answer Span:
Neither the medium black square (which is in Block C) nor the medium yellow triangle (which is in Block B) is to the right of the small black triangle.
Reference/Question Span:
It [the medium black square] is to the right of and below the small black triangle.
Question #129
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A is to the left of C. Block C is to the left of B. Block A has one small yellow circle, one small blue square and one big yellow circle. One small...
1 issue
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A is to the left of C. Block C is to the left of B. Block A has one small yellow circle, one small blue square and one big yellow circle. One small black square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. The big yellow circle is above and to the left of the small black square.. Below and near to the small blue square which is above the small black square there is the small yellow circle. It is to the right of the circle which is above the small black square. Block B has a medium yellow triangle and one small yellow circle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of and below the small yellow circle. Block C has two big yellow triangles. One medium blue triangle is also in this block. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. The medium blue triangle is to the left of, above and near to the big black square. Big yellow triangle number one is to the left of, far from and above the big black square. This block also has a small black square. Big yellow triangle number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is to the left of a big yellow triangle? the small yellow circle that is in block A or the small yellow circle that is in block B? (a) the small yellow circle that is in block A (b) the small yellow circle that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block A has a small yellow circle. Block B has a small yellow circle and a medium yellow triangle. Block C has two big yellow triangles and a big black square. Block A is to the left of Block C, and Block C is to the left of Block B. Therefore, the small yellow circle in Block A is to the left of the big yellow triangles in Block C. The small yellow circle in Block B is to the right of the big yellow triangles in Block C. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly establishes the left-to-right order of the blocks (A < C < B). It correctly deduces that the object in A is to the left of the objects in C. However, it incorrectly concludes the final answer based on the relative position of the object in B, which is not explicitly established as being to the right of the objects in C in a way that resolves the question, leading to an incomplete or potentially flawed final step, although the final choice (A) is correct based on the first part of the deduction.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context medium
Statement
The small yellow circle in Block B is to the right of the big yellow triangles in Block C.
Explanation
The reasoning chain concludes that the small yellow circle in Block B is to the right of the big yellow triangles in Block C. While Block C is to the left of Block B, the question asks which object is to the *left* of a big yellow triangle. The reasoning chain fails to establish the relative position of the small yellow circle in Block B with respect to the big yellow triangles in Block C in a way that answers the question, and instead makes an assertion about its position relative to Block C that doesn't directly address the core comparison needed for the final choice.
Answer Span:
The small yellow circle in Block B is to the right of the big yellow triangles in Block C.
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is to the left of a big yellow triangle? the small yellow circle that is in block A or the small yellow circle that is in block B?
Question #1505
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One small black square, a medium black circle and a small yellow circle are in block A. Above the medium black circle and the small yellow circle there is the small...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One small black square, a medium black circle and a small yellow circle are in block A. Above the medium black circle and the small yellow circle there is the small black square. The medium black circle is below the small yellow circle. The small yellow circle is touching the right edge of this block. Then, there is block B which contains one big blue square and one small blue square. A big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. The big blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big yellow square is to the right of and above the big blue square. Above the small blue square and the big blue square is a medium black square. It is to the left of the square which is to the right of the big blue square. Finally, to the left of block B we have block C. It is to the left of block A. It contains a medium black triangle. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a big blue circle. A small blue circle is to the left of and above the medium black triangle. To the left of the big blue circle is the medium black triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. Which object is to the right of a big blue circle? the small blue circle or the medium black circle? (a) the small blue circle (b) the medium black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block C contains the big blue circle. Block A, to the right of Block C, contains the medium black circle. Since Block A is directly to the right of Block C, the medium black circle is to the right of the big blue circle. The small blue circle is to the left of the big blue circle, within Block C. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the blocks containing the objects but fails to establish the correct spatial relationship needed to answer the final question ('Which object is to the right of a big blue circle?'). It incorrectly concludes the medium black circle is to the right of the big blue circle based on block adjacency without confirming the specific object placement relative to the big blue circle, and it ignores the fact that the small blue circle is to the left of the big blue circle.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context medium
Statement
Block A, to the right of Block C, contains the medium black circle.
Explanation
The reasoning chain claims Block A contains the medium black circle, but the context states the medium black circle is in Block A along with a small black square and a small yellow circle. More importantly, the reasoning chain uses the location of the medium black circle to answer the final question, but the question asks about the medium black circle OR the small blue circle relative to the big blue circle. The context states the medium black circle is in Block A, while the big blue circle is in Block C. The reasoning chain incorrectly assumes the medium black circle is the object being referenced in the final question, which is a possibility, but it fails to establish the relative positions correctly based on block placement.
Answer Span:
Block A, to the right of Block C, contains the medium black circle.
Reference/Question Span:
One small black square, a medium black circle and a small yellow circle are in block A.
missing_context low
Statement
The small blue circle is to the left of the big blue circle, within Block C.
Explanation
The context states: 'A small blue circle is to the left of and above the medium black triangle.' and 'To the left of the big blue circle is the medium black triangle.' This implies the small blue circle is to the left of the medium black triangle, which is to the left of the big blue circle. Therefore, the small blue circle is to the left of the big blue circle. However, the reasoning chain asserts the small blue circle is *within* Block C, which is true, but it fails to use the established spatial relationship to answer the final question about what is to the *right* of the big blue circle.
Answer Span:
The small blue circle is to the left of the big blue circle, within Block C.
Reference/Question Span:
A small blue circle is to the left of and above the medium black triangle.
Question #1506
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One small black square, a medium black circle and a small yellow circle are in block A. Above the medium black circle and the small yellow circle there is the small...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One small black square, a medium black circle and a small yellow circle are in block A. Above the medium black circle and the small yellow circle there is the small black square. The medium black circle is below the small yellow circle. The small yellow circle is touching the right edge of this block. Then, there is block B which contains one big blue square and one small blue square. A big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. The big blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big yellow square is to the right of and above the big blue square. Above the small blue square and the big blue square is a medium black square. It is to the left of the square which is to the right of the big blue square. Finally, to the left of block B we have block C. It is to the left of block A. It contains a medium black triangle. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a big blue circle. A small blue circle is to the left of and above the medium black triangle. To the left of the big blue circle is the medium black triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. What is to the right of the small blue circle? a small black square or a medium black circle? (a) small black square (b) medium black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block C contains the small blue circle, and Block A (to the right of Block C) contains the small black square and the medium black circle. Since both the small black square and the medium black circle are in Block A, which is to the right of Block C where the small blue circle is located, both of these shapes are to the right of the small blue circle. Answer: {C}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes a factual error by stating the small blue circle is in Block C, and then uses this flawed premise to incorrectly conclude that both options are to the right of the small blue circle, ignoring the actual spatial relationship required by the question.

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction high
Statement
Block C contains the small blue circle
Explanation
The context states Block C contains a medium black triangle and a big blue circle. It does not state it contains the small blue circle.
Answer Span:
Block C contains the small blue circle
Reference/Question Span:
Finally, to the left of block B we have block C. It is to the left of block A. It contains a medium black triangle. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a big blue circle.
missing_context high
Statement
Since both the small black square and the medium black circle are in Block A, which is to the right of Block C where the small blue circle is located, both of these shapes are to the right of the small blue circle.
Explanation
The reasoning chain incorrectly assumes the small blue circle is in Block C. The question states the small blue circle is to the left of and above the medium black triangle (which is in C), but it never explicitly states the small blue circle is *in* Block C. More importantly, the reasoning relies on the location of the small blue circle to determine the answer, but the relationship between the small blue circle and the objects in Block A (small black square or medium black circle) is not established in the text.
Answer Span:
Since both the small black square and the medium black circle are in Block A, which is to the right of Block C where the small blue circle is located, both of these shapes are to the right of the small blue circle.
Reference/Question Span:
What is to the right of the small blue circle? a small black square or a medium black circle?
Question #3097
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has one big yellow triangle, one medium yellow square and a small blue circle. The big yellow triangle is above and to the right of a medium ye...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has one big yellow triangle, one medium yellow square and a small blue circle. The big yellow triangle is above and to the right of a medium yellow triangle. Above the medium yellow triangle there is the small blue circle. The medium yellow square is touching the top edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and above the medium yellow triangle is the medium yellow square. Above block A we have block B with two medium yellow squares in it. This block also has a medium yellow circle. The medium yellow circle is to the left of and above medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. Finally, we have block C to the right of block B. It has two medium yellow triangles and two small yellow circles. Below small yellow circle number one and medium yellow triangle number two there is medium yellow triangle number one. Small yellow circle number one is above and to the left of small yellow circle number two. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow circle or the medium yellow square that is touching the top edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow circle (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the top edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A has a medium yellow square touching the top edge, and Block B (above Block A) contains medium yellow squares and a medium yellow circle. The medium yellow circle is above medium yellow square number two, which is above medium yellow square number one. Since Block B is directly above Block A, the objects below the medium yellow square (touching the top edge of Block A) are the medium yellow squares and circle in Block B. Answer: {C}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain completely fails to analyze the spatial relationships required to answer the question based on the options provided. It incorrectly relates objects in Block B (above) to objects in Block A, and ignores the actual question structure.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context high
Statement
Since Block B is directly above Block A, the objects below the medium yellow square (touching the top edge of Block A) are the medium yellow squares and circle in Block B.
Explanation
The reasoning incorrectly assumes that the objects *below* the medium yellow square touching the top edge of Block A are the objects *in* Block B. Block B is *above* Block A. The question asks which object is *below* a medium yellow square (referring to the options provided). The reasoning chain seems to confuse the spatial relationship or misinterprets what is being asked relative to the options.
Answer Span:
the objects below the medium yellow square (touching the top edge of Block A) are the medium yellow squares and circle in Block B
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow circle or the medium yellow square that is touching the top edge of a block?
missing_context high
Statement
Since Block B is directly above Block A, the objects below the medium yellow square (touching the top edge of Block A) are the medium yellow squares and circle in Block B.
Explanation
The reasoning chain attempts to answer the question by looking at objects *above* Block A (in Block B) relative to an object *in* Block A. The question asks which of the two *options* (medium yellow circle OR medium yellow square touching the top edge of a block) is *below* *a* medium yellow square. The reasoning ignores the options entirely and tries to establish a relationship between Block A and Block B objects.
Answer Span:
Since Block B is directly above Block A, the objects below the medium yellow square (touching the top edge of Block A) are the medium yellow squares and circle in Block B
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow circle or the medium yellow square that is touching the top edge of a block?
Question #1952
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. There are two medium blue squares in block A. This block also contains a small blue square. This block also contains a medium black triangle. One big...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. There are two medium blue squares in block A. This block also contains a small blue square. This block also contains a medium black triangle. One big black square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium blue square number one is to the left of and above medium blue square number two. Below the medium black triangle there is the small blue square. A small yellow circle is far from and above the big black square. Block B is above block A. It has one big yellow circle, one small blue circle and one medium blue triangle. This block also contains one small yellow square. The big yellow circle is to the left of and above the medium blue triangle. This object is near to the small blue circle which is to the left of, above and near to the medium blue triangle. To the right of block B there is block C. It contains two small black circles. It also contains one medium black square. Small black circle number one is below small black circle number two. The medium black square is below and to the right of small black circle number two. What is to the right of the small yellow square? a small black circle or a big black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) small black circle (b) big black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block B contains the small yellow square, and Block C, to the right of Block B, contains the small black circles. Therefore, a small black circle is to the right of the small yellow square. The big black square is in Block A, which is below Block B, so it's not to the right of the small yellow square. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the blocks containing the relevant objects (small yellow square in B, small black circles in C, big black square in A). However, it fails to incorporate the specific positional constraint of the big black square (touching the bottom edge) into its evaluation of the options, and it makes an unsubstantiated leap regarding the relative position of the small black circle to the small yellow square, ignoring the need to check the spatial relationship between objects in adjacent blocks.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context medium
Statement
The big black square is in Block A, which is below Block B, so it's not to the right of the small yellow square.
Explanation
The reasoning correctly identifies the big black square is in Block A, but it ignores the crucial positional information that the big black square is *touching the bottom edge of this block* (Block A). This detail is part of the options provided in the question and should have been retained if the reasoning was to correctly evaluate the options.
Answer Span:
The big black square is in Block A, which is below Block B, so it's not to the right of the small yellow square.
Reference/Question Span:
One big black square is also touching the bottom edge of this block.
missing_context high
Statement
Therefore, a small black circle is to the right of the small yellow square.
Explanation
The reasoning concludes that a small black circle is to the right of the small yellow square based on Block B being to the left of Block C. However, it fails to establish the relative position of the *small yellow square* within Block B relative to the *small black circles* in Block C. The question asks what is to the right of the small yellow square. The reasoning only establishes that Block C (containing small black circles) is to the right of Block B (containing the small yellow square), but it doesn't confirm if the small black circle is *immediately* or *generally* to the right of the small yellow square, which is necessary to evaluate option (a) against the specific spatial relationship implied by the question structure.
Answer Span:
Therefore, a small black circle is to the right of the small yellow square.
Reference/Question Span:
What is to the right of the small yellow square? a small black circle or a big black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block?
Question #2215
We have three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. There are one medium black square, one medium black triangle and one small yellow triangle in block A. To the left of a small yellow square is the medi...
2 issues
Full Question
We have three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. There are one medium black square, one medium black triangle and one small yellow triangle in block A. To the left of a small yellow square is the medium black square. The small yellow triangle is to the left of and below the small yellow square. The medium black triangle is to the right of and above the yellow object which is to the left of the small yellow square. Block B is below block A. It contains a big black square, a medium blue square and a small yellow square. Above a small black triangle there is the small yellow square. This block also has a small yellow triangle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. The big black square is below the small yellow square and the small black triangle.. It is to the right of the small yellow triangle. Finally, there is block C which is to the right of block A. It has one small blue triangle and one medium yellow square. Near to and to the left of the medium yellow square there is the small blue triangle. What is below the medium black triangle? a small blue triangle or a small yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) small blue triangle (b) small yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A contains the medium black triangle. Block B, below Block A, contains a small yellow square touching the right edge. Since Block B is directly below Block A, the object below the medium black triangle is the small yellow square touching the right edge of Block B. The small blue triangle is in Block C, which is to the right of Block A, not below it. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an unsubstantiated assumption about vertical alignment between objects in Block A and Block B, leading to a conclusion based on faulty spatial reasoning relative to the provided context. It fails to establish the actual object below the medium black triangle.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context high
Statement
Since Block B is directly below Block A, the object below the medium black triangle is the small yellow square touching the right edge of Block B.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes the medium black triangle in Block A is directly above the small yellow square in Block B. The context only establishes the relative positions of the blocks (B is below A) and the objects within them, but does not state that the medium black triangle is vertically aligned with the small yellow square.
Answer Span:
the object below the medium black triangle is the small yellow square touching the right edge of Block B
Reference/Question Span:
Block B is below block A.
missing_context medium
Statement
The small blue triangle is in Block C, which is to the right of block A, not below it.
Explanation
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the small blue triangle (Block C, right of A), but this information is irrelevant to answering the question: 'What is below the medium black triangle?'. The reasoning uses this fact to dismiss option (a) without establishing the actual vertical relationship between the medium black triangle and the small blue triangle.
Answer Span:
The small blue triangle is in Block C, which is to the right of block A, not below it.
Reference/Question Span:

Question #3098
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has one big yellow triangle, one medium yellow square and a small blue circle. The big yellow triangle is above and to the right of a medium ye...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has one big yellow triangle, one medium yellow square and a small blue circle. The big yellow triangle is above and to the right of a medium yellow triangle. Above the medium yellow triangle there is the small blue circle. The medium yellow square is touching the top edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and above the medium yellow triangle is the medium yellow square. Above block A we have block B with two medium yellow squares in it. This block also has a medium yellow circle. The medium yellow circle is to the left of and above medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. Finally, we have block C to the right of block B. It has two medium yellow triangles and two small yellow circles. Below small yellow circle number one and medium yellow triangle number two there is medium yellow triangle number one. Small yellow circle number one is above and to the left of small yellow circle number two. What is to the right of the object which is touching the bottom edge of a block? a big object or a medium thing which is touching the top edge of a block? (a) big object (b) medium thing which is touching the top edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block A has a medium yellow triangle touching the bottom edge. The medium yellow square is touching the top edge of Block A and is also to the right of the medium yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is also to the right of the medium yellow triangle. Thus, both a big object (the big yellow triangle) and a medium thing touching the top edge of a block (the medium yellow square) are to the right of the object touching the bottom edge of Block A. Answer: {C}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the object touching the bottom edge of Block A (medium yellow triangle) and then checks the relative positions of the two candidate objects (big yellow triangle and medium yellow square) based on the context. The conclusion derived from the reasoning matches the final answer choice.

Question #11

2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. A medium yellow triangle, one big black square and a big blue square are in block A. This block also contains one medium black circle. The medium black circle is to the right of the big black square and the big blue square. The medium yellow triangle is far from the big blue square. This block also has a big blue triangle. It is touching the right edge of this block. Near to the big blue triangle is the medium black circle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The big blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of the big black square there is the medium yellow triangle. To the left of block A we have block B with a medium yellow circle and a medium yellow triangle in it. It also has one big yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is above and to the left of the big yellow triangle. The medium yellow circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the big yellow triangle. Above block A there is block C which contains one small black square and one medium blue circle. To the left of the medium blue circle is the small black square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow triangle? the big blue triangle or the medium yellow circle? (a) the big blue triangle (b) the medium yellow circle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block A contains a medium yellow triangle and a big blue triangle. The medium yellow triangle is stated to be touching the right edge of this block, and the big blue triangle is also touching the right edge of this block. This implies they are likely overlapping or at least sharing the same edge. Block B, to the left of A, contains a medium yellow circle. Since Block B is to the left of Block A, the medium yellow circle is not to the right of the medium yellow triangle. Therefore, only the big blue triangle is to the right of the medium yellow triangle. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an incomplete list of objects in Block A and then draws a conclusion about the relative positions of objects based on block location (B left of A) without checking the specific positional constraints given in the context for the medium yellow triangle (in A or B) and the medium yellow circle (in B).

The reasoning incorrectly dismisses the medium yellow circle (in Block B) based only on Block B being to the left of Block A, ignoring that the medium yellow triangle is also in Block B, and the question asks about the object to the right of *a* medium yellow triangle.

Clean
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A is to the left of C. Block C is to the left of B. Block A has one small yellow circle, one small blue square and one big yellow circle. One small black square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. The big yellow circle is above and to the left of the small black square.. Below and near to the small blue square which is above the small black square there is the small yellow circle. It is to the right of the circle which is above the small black square. Block B has a medium yellow triangle and one small yellow circle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of and below the small yellow circle. Block C has two big yellow triangles. One medium blue triangle is also in this block. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. The medium blue triangle is to the left of, above and near to the big black square. Big yellow triangle number one is to the left of, far from and above the big black square. This block also has a small black square. Big yellow triangle number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is to the left of a medium yellow triangle? the big yellow circle or the small blue square? (a) the big yellow circle (b) the small blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block A contains the big yellow circle and the small blue square. Block B contains the medium yellow triangle. Since Block A is to the left of Block C, and Block C is to the left of Block B, both the big yellow circle and the small blue square are to the left of the medium yellow triangle. Answer: {C}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in Block A (which contains the big yellow circle and small blue square) and Block B (which contains the medium yellow triangle). It correctly uses the positional information (A is left of C, C is left of B) to conclude that objects in A are to the left of objects in B, thus answering the question.

Full Question

The medium black square is above a medium blue circle. The medium blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below and to the left of the big blue triangle. Block C contains two medium yellow squares and two other big black circles. Medium yellow square number one is above big black circle number one. Medium yellow square number two is touching the right edge of this block. Big black circle number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below big black circle number two. It is near to and to the left of medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the right of a big blue object? the medium blue circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium blue circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block B contains a big blue triangle. Block C, to the right of Block B, contains a medium yellow square touching the right edge (medium yellow square number two). The medium blue circle touching the bottom edge of a block is also in Block B, so it is not to the right of the big blue triangle. Since medium yellow square number two is in Block C which is to the right of the big blue triangle in Block B. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly frames the comparison and misses crucial positional information needed to answer the question correctly. It focuses only on Block B objects relative to the triangle in Block B, ignoring the possibility of the objects being to the right of the big blue circles in Block C.

Full Question

The big black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of the medium object which is to the left of the big yellow triangle. Block B contains one big yellow circle, a big blue square and one big yellow triangle. The big yellow circle is to the right of and above the big yellow triangle. The small yellow square is below the big yellow circle. What is to the right of the big blue circle? a big yellow circle which is in block B or a big yellow circle which is in block C? 1
Generated Answer

Since Block B is to the right of Block A, the big yellow circle in Block B is to the right of the big blue circle in Block A. The big yellow circle in Block C is not to the right of the big blue circle, as Block C is below Block A. Answer: {A}

However, the reasoning chain then states: 'The medium blue triangle is also to the left of the small black circles, as it is in the same block (B) as the small blue circle and to its left.' This implies the medium blue triangle is to the left of the small blue circle, which contradicts the source text: 'the small blue circle which is to the left of... the medium blue triangle.'

Question #3314
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A contains one big yellow square, one small yellow circle and one medium black square. Below the medium black square is the big yellow square. ...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A contains one big yellow square, one small yellow circle and one medium black square. Below the medium black square is the big yellow square. The small yellow circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of the medium black square. The big yellow square is above the small yellow circle. Block B is to the left of block A. It contains two medium blue triangles. It also contains one small blue circle. Above a medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. Medium blue triangle number one is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. To the left of and touching medium blue triangle number two there is the medium black triangle. The small blue circle is above the triangle which is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. Finally, we have block C. It is below block A. It has one big black square. A big blue square is to the right of the big black square. What is to the left of the big yellow square? a big blue square or a medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) big blue square (b) medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A contains the big yellow square. Block B, to the left of Block A, contains the medium blue triangles and the small blue circle. The big blue square is in Block C, which is below Block A, not to its left. So, the medium blue triangle touching the right edge of Block B (medium blue triangle number one) is to the left of the big yellow square. The big blue square is not to the left of the big yellow square. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes unsupported spatial claims about the relative positions of objects in Block B and Block C relative to the object in Block A, leading to a conclusion that cannot be verified or derived solely from the context provided.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context high
Statement

Explanation
The reasoning chain claims that medium blue triangle number one is to the left of the big yellow square. The question only establishes the relative positions of Block B (left of A) and the contents of Block A (which contains the big yellow square). It does not state that any object in Block B is to the left of the big yellow square, which is in Block A. This conclusion relies on an unstated spatial relationship.
Answer Span:
So, the medium blue triangle touching the right edge of Block B (medium blue triangle number one) is to the left of the big yellow square.
Reference/Question Span:
Block A contains one big yellow square, one small yellow circle and one medium black square. . . Block B is to the left of block A.

Statement
The big blue square is not to the left of the big yellow square.
Explanation
The reasoning chain asserts that the big blue square is not to the left of the big yellow square. The question establishes the big blue square is in Block C, which is below Block A (where the big yellow square is). The question asks what *is* to the left of the big yellow square, and the reasoning chain fails to establish the actual spatial relationship between the big blue square (Block C) and the big yellow square (Block A) based on the provided context, instead making an unsupported negative assertion.
Answer Span:
The big blue square is not to the left of the big yellow square.
Reference/Question Span:

Question #2085
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block C is to the left of B and block B is above A. Block A contains one small black circle. It also contains a medium yellow square. It also contains one medium ye...
3 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block C is to the left of B and block B is above A. Block A contains one small black circle. It also contains a medium yellow square. It also contains one medium yellow circle. The small black circle is above the medium yellow square. To the left of and above the medium yellow square there is the medium yellow circle. Block B has a medium blue circle. There are also one small blue triangle and one small black circle in this block. To the left of the small black circle is the small blue triangle. To the right of and below the small black circle is the medium blue circle. And block C contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number one is touching the top edge of this block. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of this block. Near to and above a big yellow square there is small blue triangle number one. This object is to the left of small blue triangle number two. Which object is above a small black circle? the small blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block or the square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block (b) the square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
3
Generated Answer
Block A contains a small black circle, a medium yellow square, and a medium yellow circle. Block B, which is above Block A, contains a medium blue circle, a small blue triangle, and a small black circle. Block C, to the left of Block B, contains two small blue triangles and a big yellow square. The question asks what is above the small black circle in Block A. Since Block B is above Block A, and the small black circle in Block B is not specified as being directly above the small black circle in Block A, neither the small blue triangle (number two) touching the right edge of Block C nor the big yellow square in Block C is directly above the small black circle in Block A. Answer: {D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes several factual errors regarding the location of the big yellow square and incorrectly focuses the analysis only on the small black circle in Block A, ignoring the positional constraints provided for the objects listed in the options relative to *a* small black circle.

Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block B is to the right of A and block C is above B. Block A contains a medium black circle. It also has a medium yellow triangle. This block also contains one medium black square. It is to the left of and above the medium black circle. The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. It is to the right of the medium black square. Block B has one big yellow square and a small black square. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. This shape is below and to the right of the small black square. The big yellow square is below the square which is below the small black square. And block C contains a big yellow triangle, one big blue square and one small black square. The big blue square is below and near to the small black square. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This shape is above the big blue square. It is to the right of the small black square. Which object is above a big black square? the circle which is touching the right edge of a block or the big blue square? (a) the circle which is touching the right edge of a block (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A contains a medium black circle touching its right edge. Block B, to the right of A, contains a big black square. Block C, above B, contains a big blue square. Thus, the big blue square in Block C is above the big black square in Block B. The medium black circle is in Block A, not above the big black square. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an assumption about the vertical relationship between objects in Block C and Block B based only on the block arrangement, ignoring the need for specific positional data. It also incorrectly implies the big blue square is the only object in C relevant to the comparison, although it correctly identifies the block contents.

Full Question

Below block A there is block B with a medium blue square and one medium yellow square in it. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square and a medium black square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Below block B there is block C. It has two medium blue squares. This block also contains one medium yellow square. It is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below medium blue square number two. It is below the yellow object which is below medium blue square number two. The question asks what is below the medium yellow square in Block B. That would be the medium black square also in Block B. The medium black square touching the bottom edge of a block is in Block A, not below the medium yellow square in question. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: fair

Block B also has a big yellow circle, but nothing is described as being to its left. Answer: {A}

Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Here's the breakdown: * **Block A:** Contains two medium black squares and one medium blue square. Medium black square one is at the bottom, below medium black square two and the medium blue square. Essentially, the blue square is at the top of Block A. * **Block B:** Contains a medium blue square and a medium yellow square. The blue square is below the yellow square. * **Block C:** Contains two medium blue squares and a medium yellow square. Medium blue square one is at the bottom, below the yellow square, which in turn is below medium blue square two. The question asks what is above a medium yellow square. There are two medium yellow squares: 1. **In Block B:** The medium blue square is below it. 2. **In Block C:** Medium blue square two is above it. Neither of the options given is "medium blue square two". The medium blue square in Block A is above the contents of Block B, but not directly above the yellow square in Block B. The medium blue square touching the bottom edge of a block (medium blue square one in Block C) is below, not above, the yellow square in Block C. Answer: {D}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the yellow squares in B and C. However, it makes an unsubstantiated claim about the blue square in Block A being at the top, and it incorrectly dismisses the relevance of the blue square in Block A without fully checking if it satisfies the condition 'above a medium yellow square' based on the block hierarchy, which is crucial for option (a).

Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block C is to the left of B and block B is above A. Block A contains one small black circle. It also contains a medium yellow square. Block B has a medium blue circle. There are also one small blue triangle and one small black circle in this block. To the left of the small black circle is the small blue triangle. To the right of and below the small black circle is the medium blue circle. And block C contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number one is touching the top edge of this block. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of this block. Near to and above a big yellow square there is small blue triangle number one. This object is to the left of small blue triangle number two. (a) the small blue triangle which is in block B (b) the object that is touching the top edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block C contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of block C. Block B is to the right of block C and contains a small blue triangle and a small black circle. Since Block B is to the right of Block C, the small blue triangle in Block B is to the right of small blue triangle number two (which is touching the right edge of Block C). Small blue triangle number one is also in Block C and is described as touching the top edge. So, the small blue triangle in Block B is to the right of small blue triangle number two, which is the thing touching the right edge of a block. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the object touching the right edge of a block (SBT #2 in C) and correctly identifies the object touching the top edge of a block (SBT #1 in C). It then attempts to compare the location of the small blue triangle in B relative to SBT #2. The assumption that 'Block B is to the right of block C' is derived from 'Block C is to the left of B', but the reasoning chain uses this derived spatial relationship to answer the final question without fully establishing the necessary positional logic based on the constraints provided for the final comparison.

Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. There is also a big yellow square touching the right edge of this block. The big yellow square is far from and to the right of the big black circle. Then, there is block B. It contains one big yellow circle, one big black triangle and a big blue square. To the left of, below and near to the big blue square there is the big yellow circle. Below the big blue square there is the big black triangle. Finally, we have block C which is to the right of block A. Block B is to the right of it. It contains one small blue circle, one big blue triangle and a small black square. The big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It also has a small yellow square. This object is to the right of the small black square. The small blue circle is above the small black square and the big blue triangle. To the right of and below the small object which is to the right of the small black square is the big blue triangle. What is to the right of the small blue circle? a big blue square or a yellow thing that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) big blue square (b) yellow thing that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block A has a big black circle and a big yellow square touching the right edge. Block C, to the right of Block A, contains a small blue circle, a big blue triangle, and a small black square. It also has a small yellow square. The big yellow square in Block A is touching the right edge. The question asks what is to the right of the small blue circle (which is in Block C). Since the big yellow square is in Block A and the small blue circle is in Block C (to the right of Block A), the big yellow square is not to the right of the small blue circle. The big blue square is in Block B, which is to the right of Block C. Therefore, neither the big blue square nor the big yellow square is to the right of the small blue circle. Answer: {D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the location of the small blue circle (Block C) but fails to correctly evaluate the spatial relationship required by the question. It makes an unsupported leap in logic regarding the big blue square's position relative to the small blue circle, and it ignores the necessary spatial analysis of the options provided in the question.

The big yellow square is touching the right edge.
Explanation

This spatial relationship is necessary to determine if objects in A or B are to the right of an object in C.
Answer Span:

Reference/Question Span:

missing_context high

The big blue square is in Block B, which is to the right of Block C. Therefore, neither the big blue square nor the big yellow square is to the right of the small blue circle.
Explanation
The reasoning chain correctly states the relative positions of the blocks (A -> C -> B). However, it incorrectly concludes that because the big blue square is in Block B (to the right of C), it cannot be to the right of the small blue circle (in C). The reasoning chain fails to check if the big blue square is *actually* to the right of the small blue circle within Block B's contents or relative to Block C's position, and it ignores the possibility that the 'yellow thing that is touching the right edge of a block' (which is the big yellow square in Block A) might still be spatially to the right of the small blue circle in C, even though they are in different blocks.

Full Question

The medium yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. This shape is below and to the right of the medium black square. Block B has a big blue triangle, one medium blue square and one small black square. One small yellow triangle is also touching the right edge of this block. It is touching and above the medium blue square. The big blue triangle is to the left of the triangle which is touching the medium blue square. It is far from and above the medium blue square. Block C contains a big blue square. To the right of a small black square there is a medium blue circle.. Near to and below the small black square there is the big blue square. This shape is above the circle which is to the right of the small black square. Which object is below a small black square? the medium blue square or the big blue square? (a) the medium blue square (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block B contains the small black square, and Block C (which is above Block B) contains the big blue square. Block A (below Block B) contains the medium black square. The big blue square is near to and below the small black square, meaning it is directly below the small black square in Block B. Therefore, the object below the small black square is the big blue square. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly places the big blue square (from Block C) into Block B and makes an unsupported leap that 'near to and below' means 'directly below' within the same block, contradicting the block structure provided in the context.

Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. A small yellow circle is in block A. Block B is to the right of block A. It has two medium yellow triangles. Above and near to a medium yellow square is medium yellow triangle number two. There is also one medium black circle in this block. It also contains a small blue circle. The small blue circle is below and touching medium yellow triangle number two. Below and to the right of medium yellow triangle number two is the medium black circle. To the right of block A there is block C which has two medium yellow squares. It also contains one medium yellow triangle. It also contains a medium yellow circle. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of and below the medium yellow circle there is the medium yellow triangle. Near to, to the left of and below the medium yellow circle is medium yellow square number two. What is to the right of the small yellow circle? a medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium yellow square which is in block B? (a) medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium yellow square which is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block A contains a small yellow circle. Block B, to the right of Block A, contains medium yellow triangles, a medium black circle, and a small blue circle, but no medium yellow squares. Block C, also to the right of Block A, contains two medium yellow squares, one of which (number one) is touching the bottom edge. Since Block C is to the right of Block A, the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge (in Block C) is to the right of the small yellow circle. There are no medium yellow squares in Block B. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the contents and relative positions of the blocks and uses this information to answer the question about what is to the right of the small yellow circle.

There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block B is to the right of A and block C is above B. Block A contains a medium black circle. It also has a medium yellow triangle. This block also contains one medium black square. It is to the left of and above the medium black circle. The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. It is to the right of the medium black square. Block B has one big yellow square and a small black square. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. This shape is below and to the right of the small black square. The big yellow square is below the square which is below the small black square. And block C contains a big yellow triangle, one big blue square and one small black square. The big blue square is below and near to the small black square. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This shape is above the big blue square. It is to the right of the small black square. What is to the right of the medium black square? a medium yellow triangle or a big black square? (a) medium yellow triangle (b) big black square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Block A contains the medium black square, medium black circle, and medium yellow triangle. The medium black square is to the left of and above the medium black circle, and the medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle and to the right of the medium black square. Therefore, the medium yellow triangle is to the right of the medium black square. The big black square is in Block B, which is to the right of Block A, not directly to the right of the medium black square within Block A. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relative positions of the shapes within Block A based on the context to determine what is to the right of the medium black square.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #3047
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block B is above and C is to the right of A. Block A has a small black square and one medium black triangle. To the left of and near to the medium bl...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block B is above and C is to the right of A. Block A has a small black square and one medium black triangle. To the left of and near to the medium black triangle there is the small black square. Block B has one medium yellow circle and one big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of, above and near to the big yellow triangle is the medium yellow circle. Block C contains one small blue square and one small yellow triangle. There is also a small yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also contains a small yellow circle. To the right of the small blue square which is near to and to the right of the small yellow triangle is the small yellow circle. Below the small yellow triangle there is the small yellow square. The small yellow circle is to the right of and below the small yellow triangle. Which object is above a small black square? the small yellow square or the big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small yellow square (b) the big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Block A contains the small black square, and Block B, which is above Block A, contains the big yellow triangle. Thus, the big yellow triangle is above the small black square. The small yellow square is in Block C, which is to the right of Block A, so it is not above the small black square. Answer: {B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the objects mentioned in the question based on the provided context and arrives at the correct conclusion.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #1074
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block B is above A and block A is to the right of C. Block A has a big yellow triangle. There is also a big blue square touching the right edge of this...
1 issue
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block B is above A and block A is to the right of C. Block A has a big yellow triangle. There is also a big blue square touching the right edge of this block. The big blue square is above the big yellow triangle. Block B has one medium black square and one small yellow square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of and below the small yellow square. Block C contains two big yellow circles. This block also has a big black circle. There is also a medium blue square in this block. It also has one small blue triangle. Big yellow circle number two is touching the top edge of this block. To the right of, near to and below big yellow circle number one there is a big black square. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of and near to the big black circle is the medium blue square. This object is below big yellow circle number two. What is above the big yellow triangle? a medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium blue square? (a) medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block A contains the big yellow triangle, and Block B (above A) contains the medium black square and the small yellow square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of Block B. Since Block B is directly above Block A, the medium black square is above the big yellow triangle. The medium blue square is in Block C. Answer: {A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the locations of the objects but makes an unsupported leap in spatial reasoning regarding the medium black square being above the big yellow triangle based only on the block positions, ignoring the need for specific object-to-object vertical alignment checks.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context medium
Statement
Since Block B is directly above Block A, the medium black square is above the big yellow triangle.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes that because Block B is above Block A, everything in Block B is above everything in Block A. The question only establishes the relative position of the blocks (B is above A), not the relative position of the objects *within* those blocks to each other, except where explicitly stated. The medium black square is in Block B, and the big yellow triangle is in Block A. While B is above A, the reasoning chain fails to check if the medium black square is *actually* above the big yellow triangle based on the provided spatial relationships, which are complex. The reasoning chain makes a leap based only on block position.
Answer Span:
Since Block B is directly above Block A, the medium black square is above the big yellow triangle.
Reference/Question Span:
Block B is above A

Full Question

To the left of medium blue circle number two there is medium blue circle number one. Block B contains one medium black square and one big blue triangle. The medium black square is above a medium blue circle. The medium blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below and to the left of the big blue triangle. Block C contains two medium yellow squares and two other big black circles. Medium yellow square number one is above big black circle number one. Medium yellow square number two is touching the right edge of this block. Big black circle number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below big black circle number two. It is near to and to the left of medium yellow square number two. What is above the triangle? a medium blue circle or a medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) medium blue circle (b) medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block B contains the big blue triangle. The medium black square is above the triangle in Block B. Block A is above Block B, and contains medium blue circles. Block C is to the right of Block B and contains medium yellow squares and big black circles. Neither the medium blue circle nor the medium yellow square touching the right edge of a block is directly above the big blue triangle in Block B. Answer: {D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain contains a direct contradiction regarding the position of the medium black square relative to the triangle and fails to correctly use the positional information (Block A is above Block B) to determine what is above the triangle.

Below medium black square number two and the medium blue square is medium black square number one. Block B has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two is a medium black square. Below the medium black square is medium yellow square number one. It is below medium yellow square number two. Block C has one medium yellow square and one medium blue square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the medium blue square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium black square that is in block B or the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium black square that is in block B (b) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Block A has two medium black squares and a medium blue square. Block B has two medium yellow squares and a medium black square. Block C has a medium yellow square and a medium blue square. The question asks what is below *a* medium yellow square. In Block B, the medium black square is below medium yellow square number two. In Block C, nothing is described as being below the medium yellow square. Therefore, only the medium black square in Block B fits the description. Answer: {A}

Block B is to the left of block A. It contains two medium blue triangles. It also contains one small blue circle. Above a medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. Medium blue triangle number one is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. To the left of and touching medium blue triangle number two there is the medium black triangle. The small blue circle is above the triangle which is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. What is above the big blue square? a medium black square or a big black square? (a) medium black square (b) big black square (c) both of them (d) none of them

Full Question

The medium yellow circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a small black square. Above the medium yellow square is the small yellow circle. The medium yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. A big yellow square is touching the left edge of this block. Far from and to the right of the big yellow square there is the medium yellow square.. The small yellow circle is to the right of the big yellow square. Below the big yellow square there is the medium yellow circle. Which object is below a big yellow square? the medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block or the circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block (b) the circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
