The small yellow circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of the medium black square. The big yellow square is above the small yellow circle. Block B is to the left of block A. It contains two medium blue triangles. It also contains one small blue circle. Above a medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. Medium blue triangle number one is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. To the left of and touching medium blue triangle number two there is the medium black triangle. The small blue circle is above the triangle which is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. Finally, we have block C. It is below block A. It has one big black square. A big blue square is to the right of the big black square. What is to the left of the big yellow square? a big blue square or a medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) big blue square (b) medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block A contains one big yellow square, one small yellow circle, and one medium black square. Below the medium black square is the big yellow square. The small yellow circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of the medium black square. The big yellow square is above the small yellow circle. Block B is to the left of block A. It contains two medium blue triangles. It also contains one small blue circle. Above a medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. Medium blue triangle number one is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. To the left of and touching medium blue triangle number two there is the medium black triangle. The small blue circle is above the triangle which is to the right of medium blue triangle number two. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. Finally, we have block C. It is below block A. It has one big black square. A big blue square is to the right of the big black square. What is to the left of the big yellow square? a big blue square or a medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) big blue square (b) medium blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of Block A. Block B contains two medium blue triangles: medium blue triangle number one (touching the right edge) and medium blue triangle number two. Since Block B is directly left of Block A and the big yellow square is in Block A, medium blue triangle number one (which is touching the right edge of Block B) is directly to the left of the big yellow square. Block C is below Block A and contains a big black square and a big blue square (to the right of the big black square). Thus, the big blue square and big black square cannot be to the left of the big yellow square since Block C is below not to the left. The answer is therefore {B}. \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the relevant blocks (A and B) but makes an unsupported assumption about the adjacency of objects across the block boundary (B to A) to conclude that medium blue triangle number one is to the left of the big yellow square. It correctly dismisses Block C.

The context only establishes the relative position of the blocks (B is left of A), not the precise alignment or adjacency of the objects within them relative to the block boundary. The reasoning jumps to the conclusion that an object in Block B must be immediately adjacent to the big yellow square based only on block placement.

Reference/Question Span:

Generated Answer

Block B has a medium blue circle. There are also one small blue triangle and one small black circle in this block. To the left of the small black circle is the small blue triangle. To the right of and below the small black circle is the medium blue circle. And block C contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number one is touching the top edge of this block. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of this block. Near to and above a big yellow square there is small blue triangle number one. This object is to the left of small blue triangle number two. Which object is above a small black circle? the small blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block or the square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small blue triangle that is touching the right edge of a block (b) the square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is above Block A and contains a small black circle, a small blue triangle, and a medium blue circle. Block C is to the left of Block B and contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of Block C. Since Block B is above Block A, and Block B contains the small black circle, the objects in Block B are above the objects in Block A. Since Block C is to the left of Block B, small blue triangle number two (touching the right edge of Block C) is not directly above the small black circle in Block B. Therefore, only the small blue triangle in Block B is above the small black circle. The small blue triangle touching the right edge of a block (Block C) is not above the small black circle. The square touching the bottom edge of a block (not mentioned in relation to Block B) is also not above the small black circle in Block B. Thus, the answer is {D}. \boxed{D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes several logical leaps and ignores crucial positional information needed to answer the question correctly. It correctly establishes Block B is above A, but fails to use the positional constraints within Block A and Block B to determine what is directly above the small black circle in Block B. It also incorrectly concludes the answer is D based on flawed spatial reasoning regarding the options provided.

Full Question

The big black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of the medium object which is to the left of the big yellow triangle. Block B contains one big yellow circle, a big blue square and one big yellow triangle. The big yellow circle is to the right of and above the big yellow triangle. This shape is touching the right edge of this block. Above the big yellow triangle is the big blue square. And block C has one small yellow circle, a small yellow square and a big yellow circle. To the left of the small yellow square and the big yellow circle there is the small yellow circle. The big yellow circle is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow square is below the big yellow circle. Which object is to the left of a big yellow circle? the small yellow circle or the big blue square? (a) the small yellow circle (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer

Above, to the right of and near to a medium black square which is to the left of and below the big yellow triangle there is the big blue circle. This block also has a big black circle. The big black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of the medium object which is to the left of the big yellow triangle. This shape is touching the right edge of this block. Above the big yellow triangle is the big blue square. And block C has one small yellow circle, a small yellow square and a big yellow circle. To the left of the small yellow square and the big yellow circle there is the small yellow circle. The big yellow circle is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow square is below the big yellow circle. Which object is to the left of a big yellow circle? the small yellow circle or the big blue square? (a) the small yellow circle (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C has a small yellow circle, a small yellow square, and a big yellow circle. The small yellow circle is to the left of both the small yellow square and the big yellow circle. Therefore, the small yellow circle is to the left of the big yellow circle in Block C. Block B contains a big yellow circle, a big blue square, and a big yellow triangle. The big blue square is above the big yellow triangle, and the big yellow circle is to the right of and above the big yellow triangle. Since Block A is to the left of Block C () and Block C is below Block B (), the big blue square in Block B is not to the left of any big yellow circle. Therefore, only the small yellow circle is to the left of a big yellow circle. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

However, it introduces irrelevant block positioning information (A left of C, C below B) to incorrectly dismiss the big blue square as a potential answer, ignoring the direct positional information provided for the objects within their respective blocks.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context high
Statement
Since Block A is to the left of Block C () and Block C is below Block B (), the big blue square in Block B is not to the left of any big yellow circle.
Explanation
The reasoning attempts to use the relative positions of the blocks (A left of C, C below B) to determine the spatial relationship between objects *within* different blocks (big blue square in B vs big yellow circle in C or B). The question asks which object (small yellow circle or big blue square) is to the left of *a* big yellow circle. The small yellow circle is explicitly stated to be to the left of the big yellow circle *in Block C*. The reasoning chain ignores this direct evidence by trying to use the block positioning, which is irrelevant for comparing objects within different blocks unless the question implied a unified coordinate system across all blocks, which it does not. Furthermore, the reasoning concludes the big blue square is not to the left of *any* big yellow circle, which is an unsupported leap based on the block positioning.
Answer Span:

Reference/Question Span:

**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block C is to the left of B and block B is above A. Block A contains one small black circle. It also contains a medium yellow square. Block B has a medium blue circle. There are also one small blue triangle and one small black circle in this block. To the left of the small black circle is the small blue triangle. To the right of and below the small black circle is the medium blue circle. And block C contains two small blue triangles. Small blue triangle number one is touching the top edge of this block. Small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of this block. Near to and above a big yellow square there is small blue triangle number one. This object is to the left of small blue triangle number two. Which object is to the right of a thing that is touching the right edge of a block? the small blue triangle which is in block B or the object that is touching the top edge of a block? (a) the small blue triangle which is in block B (b) the object that is touching the top edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block C is to the left of Block B, and small blue triangle number two is touching the right edge of Block C. Therefore, anything in Block B is to the right of small blue triangle number two. The small blue triangle is in Block B, so it is to the right of small blue triangle number two. This confirms the first option. Small blue triangle number one is touching the top edge of Block C. Since it is in Block C, it cannot be to the right of small blue triangle number two, which also touches the edge of Block C. This eliminates the second option. Therefore, only the first option is correct. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

It contains a big black square, a medium blue square and a small yellow square. Above a small black triangle there is the small yellow square. This block also has a small yellow triangle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. The big black square is below the small yellow square and the small black triangle.. It is to the right of the small yellow triangle. Finally, there is block C which is to the right of block A. It has one small blue triangle and one medium yellow square. Near to and to the left of the medium yellow square there is the small blue triangle. What is above the big thing? a medium black square or a small yellow square? (a) medium black square (b) small yellow square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is below Block A. Block A has both a medium black square and a small yellow square, and the question specifies that the small yellow triangle is below this square. Since both objects are in Block A, which is above Block B, both the medium black square and small yellow square can be considered above the big black square. Therefore, the answer is {C}. \boxed{C}

The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. This shape is below and to the right of the medium black square. It is touching and above the medium blue square. The big blue triangle is to the left of the triangle which is touching the medium blue square. It is far from and above the medium blue square. Block C contains a big blue square. To the right of a small black square there is a medium blue circle.. Near to and below the small black square there is the big blue square. This shape is above the circle which is to the right of the small black square. Which object is below a small black square? the medium blue square or the big blue square? (a) the medium blue square (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B contains the small black square, a medium blue square, and a big blue triangle. The medium blue square is in the same block as the small black square, so it cannot be below it. Therefore, the answer is {B}. \boxed{b}

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction high

Since Block C is above Block B, the big blue square (in Block C) is below the small black square (in Block B).
Explanation
If Block C is above Block B, objects in C cannot be below objects in B unless specified otherwise. The reasoning incorrectly uses the vertical stacking (C above B) to conclude that an object in C (big blue square) is below an object in B (small black square).
Answer Span:
Since Block C is above Block B, the big blue square (in Block C) is below the small black square (in Block B).
Reference/Question Span:
Block B is above block A and below block C.

Full Question

Above and near to a medium yellow square is medium yellow triangle number two. There is also one medium black circle in this block. It also contains a small blue circle. The small blue circle is below and touching medium yellow triangle number two. Below and to the right of medium yellow triangle number two is the medium black circle. To the right of block A there is block C which has two medium yellow squares. It also contains one medium yellow triangle. It also contains a medium yellow circle. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of and below the medium yellow circle there is the medium yellow triangle. Near to, to the left of and below the medium yellow circle is medium yellow square number two. What is to the right of the small yellow circle? a medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium yellow square which is in block B? (a) medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium yellow square which is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them

2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. A small yellow circle is in block A. Block B is to the right of block A. It has two medium yellow triangles. Above and near to a medium yellow square is medium yellow triangle number two. There is also one medium black circle in this block. It also contains a small blue circle. The small blue circle is below and touching medium yellow triangle number two. Below and to the right of medium yellow triangle number two is the medium black circle. To the right of block A there is block C which has two medium yellow squares. It also contains one medium yellow triangle. It also contains a medium yellow circle. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of and below the medium yellow circle there is the medium yellow triangle. Near to, to the left of and below the medium yellow circle is medium yellow square number two. What is to the right of the small yellow circle? a medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium yellow square which is in block B? (a) medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium yellow square which is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: The small yellow circle is in Block A. Block B is to the right of Block A and contains medium yellow triangles, a medium yellow square, a medium black circle, and a small blue circle. Block C is also to the right of Block A and contains a medium yellow triangle, a medium yellow circle, and two medium yellow squares, one of which touches the bottom edge. Since the question asks what is to the right of the small yellow circle (in Block A), and both Block B and Block C are to the right of Block A, the possible answers are objects within Block B or Block C. Block B contains a medium yellow square. Block C contains a medium yellow square touching the bottom edge. Both of these meet the criteria of being to the right of the small yellow circle. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{C}$
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the small yellow circle (Block A) and that the objects to its right must be in Block B or C. However, it incorrectly states that Block B contains a medium yellow square, which is not supported by the context, leading to an error in evaluating option (b).

The medium blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below the medium black square. (a) the medium blue square that is in block A (b) the medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has two medium black squares and a medium blue square. So the medium blue square of Block C is to the right of Block A, which contains the black squares. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$

It focuses too much on the relative positions of the blocks (A, B, C) and makes an irrelevant deduction about Block A's blue square relative to Block C, rather than analyzing the internal structure of the blocks as described in the context.

The small yellow triangle is below the small blue circle. This block also has a big yellow triangle. Block B has a medium yellow circle, one small black square and a big black square. To the left of a small yellow square which is to the right of and near to the medium blue triangle there is the big black circle. The medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the right of the medium blue triangle. This shape is below the small yellow square. What is above the shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block? a big black square or a small yellow triangle? (a) big black square (b) small yellow triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C contains the medium black triangle which is touching the bottom edge. Block B is above Block C. Block B contains a big black square. Since the medium black triangle is touching the bottom edge of Block C and Block B (containing the big black square) is above Block C, then the big black square is above the shape that is touching the bottom edge of Block C (medium black triangle). The small yellow triangle is in Block A, which is not above Block C. Therefore, the answer is \boxed{A}.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the shape touching the bottom edge (medium black triangle in C) and correctly determines what is above it (the contents of Block B, which includes a big black square). It correctly dismisses the small yellow triangle as being in Block A.

Which object is to the left of a big blue square? the medium black square or the big black circle that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium black square (b) the big black circle that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains the big blue square. The big black circle is not touching the right edge of Block C; a big yellow circle is. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$

However, it fails to properly evaluate the medium black square's position relative to the big blue square, concluding it's not to the left based only on vertical stacking, which ignores the possibility of horizontal overlap. It also introduces an irrelevant and potentially contradictory statement about the right edge of Block C.

Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block B is above block A and below block C. Block A contains a medium yellow triangle, one medium black square and a medium black circle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. This shape is below and to the right of the medium black square. Block B has a big blue triangle, one medium blue square and one small black square. One small yellow triangle is also touching the right edge of this block. It is touching and above the medium blue square. The big blue triangle is to the left of the triangle which is touching the medium blue square. It is far from and above the medium blue square. Block C contains a big blue square. To the right of a small black square there is a medium blue circle.. Near to and below the small black square there is the big blue square. This shape is above the circle which is to the right of the small black square. What is above the medium yellow triangle? a big blue square or a medium blue circle? (a) big blue square (b) medium blue circle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains the medium yellow triangle. Block B is above Block A. Block B contains a big blue triangle, a medium blue square, and a small black square. Block C is above Block B and contains a big blue square. Since Block B is directly above Block A, the shapes in Block B are above the medium yellow triangle in Block A. Therefore, the objects above the medium yellow triangle are the big blue triangle, the medium blue square, and the small black square (all in Block B). Neither the big blue square (in Block C) nor the medium blue circle (not mentioned in any block) are directly above the medium yellow triangle. Thus, the answer is \boxed{(d) none of them}.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the block hierarchy (A < B < C) and correctly identifies the contents of Block A. However, it makes an unsupported assumption about direct vertical alignment when concluding what is 'above' the object in A, and it incorrectly claims the medium blue circle is not mentioned in any block, ignoring context placing it in Block C.

(a) the medium blue square that is in block A (b) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: In Block A, the medium blue square is below the two medium black squares (, , , ). In Block C, the medium blue square is below the medium black square and touching the bottom edge (). So, the medium blue square is below a medium black square. The medium blue square in Block A and the medium blue square in Block C are both below a medium black square. \boxed{C}

It also correctly identifies that the medium blue square in Block C is below a medium black square. Statement
In Block C, the medium blue square is below the medium black square and touching the bottom edge().
Explanation
The context states the medium blue square in Block C is touching the bottom edge, and that *another object* (implied to be the medium black square based on the next sentence) is above it, but it does not explicitly state the medium blue square is *below* the medium black square in Block C. The context says: 'The medium blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below the medium black square.' The 'This object' refers to the medium blue square, meaning the medium black square is above the medium blue square, which means the medium blue square is below the medium black square. However, the reasoning chain incorrectly implies the medium blue square is below the medium black square *and* touching the bottom edge, which is true, but the reasoning chain then concludes it is below a medium black square based on this, which is correct, but the initial statement about Block A was flawed.

It is below the medium blue square. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow square that is in block B? (a) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. Two medium blue squares are in block A. One medium yellow square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. There is also a medium black square in this block. The medium yellow square is below the medium black square. Medium blue square number two is below the medium black square. The medium yellow square is below medium blue square number one which is below the medium black square. It is below medium blue square number two. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow square in it. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Below block A and to the left of block B there is block C. It contains one medium black square and one medium blue square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow square that is in block B? (a) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium black square, two medium blue squares, and a medium yellow square touching the bottom edge. Block B (which is to the right of Block C) contains a medium yellow square. Block C contains a medium black square. Since Block C is below Block A and to the left of Block B, only the medium yellow square in Block B is to the right of the medium black square in Block C. The medium yellow square in Block A is above Block C, not to its right. Therefore, the answer is {B}.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the objects in each block but makes an assumption about the relative horizontal positioning of Block B to Block C that is not explicitly stated as a direct fact, although it is implied by the context. Crucially, the reasoning chain correctly identifies the relevant black square (in C) and the two yellow squares being compared (one touching A's bottom edge, one in B) and uses the spatial relationship (left/right) to eliminate one option, leading to the correct conclusion based on the implied layout.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context medium
Statement
Block B (which is to the right of Block C) contains a medium yellow square.
Explanation
The reasoning chain introduces the positional relationship between Block B and Block C ('to the right of Block C') without grounding it in the context, which only states 'Below block A and to the left of block B there is block C.' The relative horizontal position of B to C is not explicitly stated as 'B is to the right of C' in the context, although it is implied by C being 'to the left of block B'. However, the reasoning chain uses this relationship to justify the final answer, and the context only establishes C's position relative to A and B, not B's position relative to C.
Answer Span:
Block B (which is to the right of Block C) contains a medium yellow square.
Reference/Question Span:
Below block A and to the left of block B there is block C.

Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block B is to the right of A and block C is above B. Block A contains a medium black circle. It also has a medium yellow triangle. This block also contains one medium black square. It is to the left of and above the medium black circle. The medium black circle is touching the right edge of this block. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. It is to the right of the medium black square. Block B has one big yellow square and a small black square. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. This shape is below and to the right of the small black square. The big yellow square is below the square which is below the small black square. And block C contains a big yellow triangle, one big blue square and one small black square. The big blue square is below and near to the small black square. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This shape is above the big blue square. It is to the right of the small black square. What is to the right of the medium black square? a medium yellow triangle or a big black square? (a) medium yellow triangle (b) big black square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block B is to the right of A and block C is above B. Block A contains a medium black circle. It also has a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. It is to the right of the medium black square. Block B has one big yellow square and a small black square. There is also a big black square touching the right edge of this block. This shape is below and to the right of the small black square. The big yellow square is below the square which is below the small black square. And block C contains a big yellow triangle, one big blue square and one small black square. The big blue square is below and near to the small black square. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This shape is above the big blue square. It is to the right of the small black square. What is to the right of the medium black square? a medium yellow triangle or a big black square? (a) medium yellow triangle (b) big black square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium black square, a medium black circle, and a medium yellow triangle. The medium black square is to the left of and above the medium black circle, and the medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle and to the right of the medium black square. Block B is to the right of Block A, and contains a big black square. Since the medium yellow triangle is explicitly stated as being to the right of the medium black square (within Block A), the answer is medium yellow triangle. The big black square is in Block B, which is to the right of Block A as a whole, not specifically to the right of the medium black square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relationship between the medium black square and the medium yellow triangle within Block A based on the context and uses this to answer the question.

Block C contains one small blue square and one small yellow triangle. There is also a small yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also contains a small yellow circle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of, above and near to the big yellow triangle is the medium yellow circle. Block C contains one small blue square and one small yellow triangle. There is also a small yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also contains a small yellow circle. To the right of the small blue square which is near to and to the right of the small yellow triangle is the small yellow circle. Below the small yellow triangle there is the small yellow square. The small yellow circle is to the right of and below the small yellow triangle. Which object is above a small black square? the small yellow square or the big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small yellow square (b) the big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains the small black square. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of Block B, so the big yellow triangle is above the small black square. The small yellow square is in Block C, which is to the right of Block A, not above it. Therefore, the answer is {B}. \boxed{b}

The medium blue square is in Block C, and Block C is to the left of Block A, not above it. The reasoning chain fails to use the most direct piece of information regarding what is above the triangle.

Medium yellow square number two is touching the right edge of this block. Big black circle number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is to the left of medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below big black circle number two. It is near to and to the left of medium yellow square number two. What is above the triangle? a medium blue circle or a medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) medium blue circle (b) medium yellow square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B contains the big blue triangle. Block C is to the right of Block B, so the medium yellow square touching the right edge of Block C is not above the triangle in Block B. The medium yellow squares are in block C which is not above the triangle in question. Therefore, the object above the triangle is a medium blue circle. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

Question #300
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has two medium black squares. It also has one medium blue square. This shape is below medium black square number two. Medium black square numbe...
1 issue
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has two medium black squares. It also has one medium blue square. This shape is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square and medium black square number two. Below block A is block B which has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Finally, we have block C. It is to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square that is in block A? (a) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has two medium black squares. It also has one medium blue square. This shape is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square and medium black square number two. Below block A is block B which has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Finally, we have block C. It is to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square that is in block A? (a) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium blue square and two medium black squares. Block B is below block A and has two medium yellow squares and a medium blue square. Block C is to the left of Block B and contains a medium yellow square and a medium black square. The question asks what is below a medium yellow square. Specifically, we are looking at the medium yellow square in Block C, since the question does not mention the medium yellow squares in Block B. The medium yellow square in block C is touching the bottom edge of Block C, meaning there is nothing below it within that block. Therefore, the answer is the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of block B. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly summarizes the contents of the blocks but fails to correctly interpret the scope of the question. It arbitrarily focuses only on the yellow square in Block C and ignores the yellow squares in Block B, which are necessary to evaluate option (a) correctly based on the context provided.

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context high
Statement
The medium yellow square in block C is touching the bottom edge of Block C, meaning there is nothing below it within that block. Therefore, the answer is the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of block B.
Explanation
The reasoning incorrectly assumes the question is only asking about the medium yellow square in Block C. The question asks generally 'Which object is below a medium yellow square?' and presents two options involving blue squares. The reasoning ignores the existence and location of the yellow squares in Block B, which are crucial for evaluating option (a).
Answer Span:
The medium yellow square in block C is touching the bottom edge of Block C, meaning there is nothing below it within that block. Therefore, the answer is the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of block B.
Reference/Question Span:
Below block A is block B which has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two.
Question #709
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A contains one big black circle and a medium blue triangle. To the right of, far from and above the medium blue triangle there is the big black...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A contains one big black circle and a medium blue triangle. To the right of, far from and above the medium blue triangle there is the big black circle. The medium blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of block A we have block B with one medium blue square and a medium black circle in it. Above a big black triangle there is the medium blue square. It is near to, below and to the right of the medium black circle. To the right of block A there is block C. It contains one medium yellow square and one medium yellow circle. This block also has a big yellow triangle. Above and to the right of a small black square there is the medium yellow square. Above a big yellow square is the medium yellow circle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Near to and to the right of the medium yellow circle is the medium yellow square. The small black square is to the left of the medium yellow circle. Which object is to the right of a medium blue square? the medium yellow square or the small thing? (a) the medium yellow square (b) the small thing (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block A contains one big black circle and a medium blue triangle. To the right of, far from, and above the medium blue triangle there is the big black circle. The medium blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of block A we have block B with one medium blue square and a medium black circle in it. Above a big black triangle there is the medium blue square. It is near to, below, and to the right of the medium black circle. To the right of block A there is block C. It contains one medium yellow square and one medium yellow circle. This block also has a big yellow triangle. Above and to the right of a small black square there is the medium yellow square. Above a big yellow square is the medium yellow circle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Near to and to the right of the medium yellow circle is the medium yellow square. The small black square is to the left of the medium yellow circle. Which object is to the right of a medium blue square? the medium yellow square or the small thing? (a) the medium yellow square (b) the small thing (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B is to the left of Block A, and Block C is to the right of Block A. The medium blue square is in Block B. Since Block C is to the right of Block A, and Block A is to the right of Block B, then Block C is also to the right of Block B. The objects in Block C, including the small black square and the medium yellow square, are therefore to the right of the medium blue square in Block B. Therefore, the medium yellow square is to the right of the medium blue square, and the small black square is also to the right of the medium blue square. Final Answer: \boxed{C}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes a critical, unsupported leap in logic by assuming that because Block C is generally to the right of Block B, every object in C is to the right of the medium blue square in B. The context does not provide sufficient relational data to confirm the position of the small black square relative to the medium blue square, making the conclusion that both options are correct unsupported by the source text.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context high
Statement
The objects in Block C, including the small black square and the medium yellow square, are therefore to the right of the medium blue square in Block B.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes that because Block C is to the right of Block A, and Block A is to the right of Block B, all objects in Block C are to the right of all objects in Block B. The context only describes relative positions *between* specific objects or edges, not the relative position of every object in Block C to every object in Block B. The question asks which object is to the right of the medium blue square, and the context only establishes the relative position of the medium yellow square to the medium yellow circle, and the small black square to the medium yellow circle, not their relation to the medium blue square.
Answer Span:
The objects in Block C, including the small black square and the medium yellow square, are therefore to the right of the medium blue square in Block B.
Reference/Question Span:
To the left of block A we have block B with one medium blue square and a medium black circle in it. To the right of block A there is block C. It contains one medium yellow square and one medium yellow circle. This block also has a big yellow triangle.
missing_context high
Statement
Therefore, the medium yellow square is to the right of the medium blue square, and the small black square is also to the right of the medium blue square.
Explanation
This conclusion is based on the flawed assumption in the previous step. The context does not explicitly state the position of the small black square relative to the medium blue square. The context only states the small black square is to the left of the medium yellow circle.
Answer Span:
Therefore, the medium yellow square is to the right of the medium blue square, and the small black square is also to the right of the medium blue square.
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is to the right of a medium blue square? the medium yellow square or the small thing?
Question #3126
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is below B. Block C is to the right of A. Block A has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. M...
1 issue
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is below B. Block C is to the right of A. Block A has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B has one big black square and a big black circle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black circle. The big black circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big black square is to the right of the big black circle and the small black circle. And block C has one big black triangle. There is also a small yellow circle in this block. Near to and to the left of the big black triangle is the small yellow circle. The big black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the big black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the small black circle? (a) the big black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the small black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is below B. Block C is to the right of A. Block A has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B has one big black square and a big black circle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black circle. The big black circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big black square is to the right of the big black circle and the small black circle. And block C has one big black triangle. There is also a small yellow circle in this block. Near to and to the left of the big black triangle is the small yellow circle. The big black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the big black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the small black circle? (a) the big black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the small black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains medium yellow squares. Block C is to the right of Block A and contains a big black triangle. Block B, which is above Block A, contains a small black circle. Since Block C is directly to the right of Block A, the big black triangle is to the right of the medium yellow squares. The small black circle is in Block B, which is above Block A, so it is not to the right of the medium yellow squares. Therefore, only the big black triangle is to the right of a medium yellow square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies that Block C is to the right of A, which contains the medium yellow squares, and correctly links the big black triangle (in C) to being to the right of the medium yellow squares. However, it makes an assumption about the horizontal placement of Block B (containing the small black circle) relative to A, or incorrectly dismisses the small black circle based only on its vertical placement in Block B, ignoring the possibility that Block B might also extend horizontally to the right of A.

Detected Issues (1)

contradiction medium
Statement
Block B, which is above Block A, contains a small black circle.
Explanation
The context states Block A is below B, meaning B is above A. However, the reasoning chain incorrectly implies that the small black circle's location relative to the medium yellow squares (in A) is determined by B being *above* A, which is irrelevant to the question asking what is to the *right* of a medium yellow square. More critically, the reasoning chain uses the relative vertical position (B is above A) to dismiss the small black circle, but the crucial missing piece is that the small black circle is in Block B, and we don't know the horizontal relationship between Block B and Block A, only that C is to the right of A.
Answer Span:
The small black circle is in Block B, which is above Block A, so it is not to the right of the medium yellow squares.
Reference/Question Span:
Block A is below B.
Question #2375
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. There is also a big yellow square touching the right edge of this block. The big yellow square is far from and to the right of t...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. There is also a big yellow square touching the right edge of this block. The big yellow square is far from and to the right of the big black circle. Then, there is block B. It contains one big yellow circle, one big black triangle and a big blue square. To the left of, below and near to the big blue square there is the big yellow circle. Below the big blue square there is the big black triangle. Finally, we have block C which is to the right of block A. Block B is to the right of it. It contains one small blue circle, one big blue triangle and a small black square. The big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It also has a small yellow square. This object is to the right of the small black square. The small blue circle is above the small black square and the big blue triangle. To the right of and below the small object which is to the right of the small black square is the big blue triangle. Which object is to the left of a small blue circle? the big black circle or the big black triangle? (a) the big black circle (b) the big black triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. There is also a big yellow square touching the right edge of this block. The big yellow square is far from and to the right of the big black circle. Then, there is block B. It contains one big yellow circle, one big black triangle and a big blue square. To the left of, below and near to the big blue square there is the big yellow circle. Below the big blue square there is the big black triangle. Finally, we have block C which is to the right of block A. Block B is to the right of it. It contains one small blue circle, one big blue triangle and a small black square. The big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It also has a small yellow square. This object is to the right of the small black square. The small blue circle is above the small black square and the big blue triangle. To the right of and below the small object which is to the right of the small black square is the big blue triangle. Which object is to the left of a small blue circle? the big black circle or the big black triangle? (a) the big black circle (b) the big black triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: We have three blocks: A, B, and C. Block A contains a big black circle. Block C is to the right of Block A and Block B is to the right of Block C. Therefore, the order of blocks from left to right is A, C, B. Block C contains a small blue circle. We want to know what is to the left of the small blue circle. Since Block C contains the small blue circle and Block A is to the left of Block C, the big black circle is to the left of the small blue circle. Since the big black triangle is in Block B and Block B is to the right of Block C, the big black triangle is to the right and not to the left of the small blue circle. Therefore, only the big black circle is to the left of the small blue circle. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the block order (A, C, B) and the location of the small blue circle (Block C) and the big black circle (Block A). However, it makes an unsubstantiated leap regarding the big black triangle's position relative to the small blue circle based only on block membership and block order, ignoring the specific positional constraints needed to answer the question definitively. The question asks which object is *to the left of* the small blue circle, requiring specific spatial relationships, not just block adjacency.

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction low
Statement
Block C is to the right of Block A and Block B is to the right of Block C.
Explanation
The context states: 'Block C which is to the right of block A. Block B is to the right of it.' This means the order is A, C, B. The reasoning chain correctly deduces A, C, B, but the statement implies the reasoning used this specific sequence as a premise, which is slightly different from the context's phrasing, but the main issue is the next contradiction.
Answer Span:
Block C is to the right of Block A and Block B is to the right of Block C.
Reference/Question Span:

missing_context high
Statement

Explanation
The reasoning assumes the big black triangle is in Block B, but the question only states Block B contains the big black triangle. The question asks about the relative position of objects *within* the blocks or *between* blocks based on proximity/directionality clues, not just block membership. Crucially, the reasoning fails to check the specific positional relationship between the big black triangle (in B) and the small blue circle (in C) based on the provided spatial constraints, relying only on block order, which is insufficient for determining 'left of' between objects in different blocks unless explicitly stated or derivable from the block arrangement relative to the objects.
Answer Span:
Since the big black triangle is in Block B and Block B is to the right of Block C, the big black triangle is to the right and not to the left of the small blue circle.
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is to the left of a small blue circle? the big black circle or the big black triangle?
Question #2544
There are three blocks, A, B and C. There is a medium yellow square in block A. Above block A there is block B which contains one medium blue triangle and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow t...
1 issue
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. There is a medium yellow square in block A. Above block A there is block B which contains one medium blue triangle and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue triangle is near to a medium yellow circle. It is above the medium yellow triangle. Below the medium yellow circle is the medium yellow triangle. To the right of block A there is block C with one medium yellow square and a big yellow square in it. A small blue triangle is above the medium yellow square. The medium yellow square is above the big yellow square. The big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. This object is near to and far from a big blue square. The small blue triangle is to the right of the big blue square. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the big yellow square which is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the big yellow square which is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B and C. There is a medium yellow square in block A. Above block A there is block B which contains one medium blue triangle and a medium yellow triangle. The medium yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue triangle is near to a medium yellow circle. It is above the medium yellow triangle. Below the medium yellow circle is the medium yellow triangle. To the right of block A there is block C with one medium yellow square and a big yellow square in it. A small blue triangle is above the medium yellow square. The medium yellow square is above the big yellow square. The big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. This object is near to and far from a big blue square. The small blue triangle is to the right of the big blue square. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the big yellow square which is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the big yellow square which is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium yellow square. Block B is above Block A and contains a medium yellow triangle (touching the bottom edge) and a medium blue triangle above it. Block C is to the right of Block A and contains a medium yellow square and a big yellow square (touching the right edge) with the medium yellow square above the big yellow square. The question asks what is above a medium yellow square. In Block C, the medium yellow square is above the big yellow square. In Block B (above Block A), the medium yellow triangle is present, but it is not above the medium yellow square in Block A. Therefore, only the big yellow square is above a medium yellow square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly concludes that only the big yellow square is above a medium yellow square by failing to properly evaluate the first option (the medium yellow triangle) against the question's requirement ('Which object is above *a* medium yellow square?'). It incorrectly dismisses the medium yellow triangle based on its location relative to the medium yellow square in Block A, ignoring that the question asks about *any* medium yellow square.

Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the big yellow square which is touching the right edge of a block?
Question #3048
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block B is above and C is to the right of A. Block A has a small black square and one medium black triangle. To the left of and near to the medium bl...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block B is above and C is to the right of A. Block A has a small black square and one medium black triangle. To the left of and near to the medium black triangle there is the small black square. Block B has one medium yellow circle and one big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of, above and near to the big yellow triangle is the medium yellow circle. Block C contains one small blue square and one small yellow triangle. There is also a small yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also contains a small yellow circle. To the right of the small blue square which is near to and to the right of the small yellow triangle is the small yellow circle. Below the small yellow triangle there is the small yellow square. The small yellow circle is to the right of and below the small yellow triangle. What is to the left of the small yellow circle? a small blue square or a big object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) small blue square (b) big object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block B is above A and C is to the right of A. Block A has a small black square and one medium black triangle. To the left of and near to the medium black triangle there is the small black square. Block B has one medium yellow circle and one big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of, above and near to the big yellow triangle is the medium yellow circle. Block C contains one small blue square and one small yellow triangle. There is also a small yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also contains a small yellow circle. To the right of the small blue square which is near to and to the right of the small yellow triangle is the small yellow circle. Below the small yellow triangle there is the small yellow square. The small yellow circle is to the right of and below the small yellow triangle. What is to the left of the small yellow circle? a small blue square or a big object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) small blue square (b) big object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C contains a small blue square, a small yellow triangle, and a small yellow circle. The small yellow circle is to the right of the small blue square, which is to the right of the small yellow triangle. Therefore, the small blue square is directly to the left of the small yellow circle. This eliminates option (b). Block B has a big yellow triangle touching its bottom edge. However, Block C (containing the small yellow circle) is to the right of Block A, and Block B is above Block A. Thus, neither Block B nor its contents are to the left of the small yellow circle. This eliminates option (b) and (c). Since the small blue square is directly to the left of the small yellow circle (both in Block C), the answer is the small blue square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the relevant objects in Block C and uses the positional information provided in the context to determine what is to the left of the small yellow circle. It correctly eliminates the 'big object' option based on location.

Question #301

Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has two medium black squares. It also has one medium blue square. This shape is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square and medium black square number two. Below block A is block B which has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Finally, we have block C. It is to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is below a medium black square? the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or medium yellow square number one? (a) the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium yellow square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has two medium black squares. It also has one medium blue square. This shape is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square and medium black square number two. Below block A is block B which has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Finally, we have block C. It is to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is below a medium black square? the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or medium yellow square number one? (a) the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium yellow square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C contains a medium black square, below which is a medium yellow square touching the bottom edge. Block B (below Block A) has two medium yellow squares, one on top of the other, medium yellow square number one being below medium yellow square number two. Since Block C is to the left of Block B, the bottom yellow square in Block C is not directly under any squares in Block B. The question asks what is below a medium black square. The medium black square is in Block C, and the object directly below it is the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of Block C. Therefore, the answer is {A}. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the relevant block (C) for one of the candidates but includes irrelevant details about Block B's internal structure, which doesn't directly help answer the comparison required by the question. However, it correctly identifies the object below the black square in Block C.

Question #1154
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Two medium black squares are in block A. One medium yellow square is also in this block. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. T...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Two medium black squares are in block A. One medium yellow square is also in this block. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below the medium yellow square and medium black square number two. Below the medium yellow square there is medium black square number two. Then, we have block B. It has one medium black square and one medium blue square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square. Finally, we have block C which is above block A. Block B is to the right of it. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has one medium black square. This block also contains a medium blue square. Below the medium yellow square and the medium blue square there is the medium black square. Below the medium blue square there is the medium yellow square. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium blue square that is in block C or the medium blue square which is in block B? (a) the medium blue square that is in block C (b) the medium blue square which is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Two medium black squares are in block A. One medium yellow square is also in this block. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below the medium yellow square and medium black square number two. Below the medium yellow square there is medium black square number two. Then, we have block B. It has one medium black square and one medium blue square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square. Finally, we have block C which is above block A. Block B is to the right of it. It contains a medium yellow square. This block also has one medium black square. This block also contains a medium blue square. Below the medium yellow square and the medium blue square there is the medium black square. Below the medium blue square there is the medium yellow square. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium blue square that is in block C or the medium blue square which is in block B? (a) the medium blue square that is in block C (b) the medium blue square which is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B is to the right of Block C. Block C has a medium black square. Block B contains a medium blue square. Therefore, the medium blue square in Block B is to the right of the medium black square in Block C. Block C also has a medium blue square. This medium blue square (in C) is not to the right of the medium black square (also in C); rather, it is above the medium black square. Thus, only the medium blue square in Block B is to the right of a medium black square (the one in Block C). Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the spatial relationship between the blocks and uses the information about the contents of Block B and Block C to answer the question about which blue square is to the right of a black square.

There is also a medium black square in this block. The medium yellow square is below the medium black square. Medium blue square number two is below the medium black square. The medium yellow square is below medium blue square number one which is below the medium black square. It is below medium blue square number two. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow square in it. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Below block A and to the left of block B there is block C. It contains one medium black square and one medium blue square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium blue square. Which object is above a medium blue square? medium blue square number one or the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium blue square number one (b) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: In Block A, the arrangement from top to bottom is: medium black square, medium blue square number two, medium blue square number one, and medium yellow square (touching the bottom). Finally, in Block C the medium blue square is above the medium black square (which touches the bottom edge). The question asks what is above "a" medium blue square, not specifically which medium blue square. Since medium blue square number one has medium blue square number two above it and the medium blue square in Block B has a medium yellow square above it, the answer is {C}. \boxed{c}

The big yellow triangle is far from and to the right of a big blue triangle which is to the right of and above the small yellow square. Block B has two big blue squares. This block also contains one big blue circle. This block also has a small yellow triangle. It also has one small black circle. Big blue square number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big blue circle is to the right of big blue square number two and big blue square number one. And block C has two big black squares. Big black square number one is touching the right edge of this block. This object is to the right of a big yellow triangle and big black square number two. Which object is to the right of a small yellow triangle? the big blue circle that is touching the right edge of a block or the object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the big blue circle that is touching the right edge of a block (b) the object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B contains a small yellow triangle, two big blue squares, and a big blue circle. Big blue square number two is touching the bottom edge of Block B, and the big blue circle is to the right of both blue squares. Block C contains two big black squares, with big black square number one touching the right edge. Since we're looking for what is to the right of the small yellow triangle in Block B, and the big blue circle is to the right of the other shapes within Block B, the big blue circle is to the right of the small yellow triangle. The question states that the big blue circle is to the right of big blue square number two. Big blue square number two is the object touching the bottom edge of block B. Therefore, both the big blue circle and the object touching the bottom edge (big blue square number two) are to the right of the small yellow triangle. Even though big black square number one is touching the right edge of Block C, it is not in Block B, and Block B is to the left of Block C. So, the answer is {C}. \boxed{C}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the contents of Block B and attempts to answer the question. However, it makes an unsupported leap regarding the relationship between the small yellow triangle and the other objects in Block B, and incorrectly frames a statement from the context as the justification for its conclusion about the small yellow triangle. Crucially, the reasoning chain fails to establish *why* the big blue circle is to the right of the small yellow triangle, which is the core requirement for answering the question, instead relying on an assumption based on the relative positions of the blue squares and the circle within Block B.

Reformatted Question: There are two blocks. We call them A and B. There are a small black circle, one medium black square and a big yellow square in block A. It also contains a medium black triangle. It is touching the right edge of this block. It is above the medium black triangle. To the right of the square which is to the left of the medium black triangle is the small black circle. Below block A we have block B which contains one big blue triangle, a big yellow square and one small yellow triangle. The big blue triangle is above and to the left of the small yellow triangle. It is above the big yellow square. To the left of the small yellow triangle is the big yellow square. Which object is to the left of a shape which is touching the bottom edge of a block? the big yellow square that is in block A or the big yellow square that is in block B? (a) the big yellow square that is in block A (b) the big yellow square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a big yellow square, a medium black square (touching the right edge), a medium black triangle, and a small black circle. Block B is below Block A and contains a big yellow square, a big blue triangle, and a small yellow triangle. The question asks which big yellow square (in A or in B) is to the left of a shape touching the bottom edge of a block. Since Block B is below Block A, any shape touching the bottom edge of a block must be in Block B. The big yellow square in Block B is to the left of the small yellow triangle. This small yellow triangle could be touching the bottom edge of Block B. Therefore, the big yellow square in Block B is to the left of a shape potentially touching the bottom edge of a block. The big yellow square in Block A cannot be to the left of anything in Block B, since Block A is above Block B. Therefore, the answer is {b}. \boxed{b}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in each block and logically deduces which block's contents are relevant to the final question based on the spatial relationship described ('Below block A we have block B'). The conclusion that the object must be in Block B is sound based on the context provided.

The medium yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. There is also one small blue triangle touching the right edge of this block. Near to and above the medium yellow triangle is the small blue triangle. Block B has one medium yellow square, a big yellow circle and a big blue circle. The medium yellow square is below a big blue triangle. To the right of the big blue circle is the big yellow circle. This object is near to and to the left of the big blue triangle. The medium yellow square is to the right of the big blue circle. The big blue triangle is touching the right edge of this block. And block C has one medium blue triangle, one big yellow circle and a small blue triangle. To the right of and near to the big yellow circle which is to the right of and below the small blue triangle is the medium blue triangle. What is near to the big blue triangle? a big yellow circle or a medium yellow triangle? (a) big yellow circle (b) medium yellow triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B contains a big blue triangle, a big yellow circle, and a medium yellow square. The big yellow circle is near to and to the left of the big blue triangle. Block A, which is to the right of Block B, has a medium yellow triangle. Since the big yellow circle is in the same block (Block B) as the big blue triangle, and the medium yellow triangle is in a different block (Block A), only the big yellow circle is near the big blue triangle. Final Answer: \boxed{a}
Overall Quality: poor

It also uses flawed logic by assuming proximity is only determined by being in the same block, ignoring explicit positional clues provided in the context, although it correctly identifies the relationship between the big yellow circle and the big blue triangle.

Above the big blue circle there is the small yellow triangle. Block B has a big yellow circle. And block C contains one small black square, a big yellow triangle and a big yellow circle.
