Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. There are one small black square, one small black circle and one big black square in block A. The small black square is below and near to the small black circle. This object is to the left of the big black square. Below block A we have block B with one big blue circle, one small blue circle and a medium blue triangle in it. The big blue circle is above the medium blue triangle which is near to a big yellow triangle. The small blue circle is above the big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Near to and to the left of the medium blue triangle there is the small blue circle. To the left of block A there is block C. It contains one small yellow circle and a big black square. To the right of the big black square there is the small yellow circle. What is below the small black circle? a small black square or a big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) small black square (b) big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B and C. There are one small black square, one small black circle and one big black square in block A. The small black square is below and near to the small black circle. This object is to the left of the big black square. Below block A we have block B with one big blue circle, one small blue circle and a medium blue triangle in it. The big blue circle is above the medium blue triangle which is near to a big yellow triangle. The small blue circle is above the big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Near to and to the left of the medium blue triangle there is the small blue circle. To the left of block A there is block C. It contains one small yellow circle and a big black square. To the right of the big black square there is the small yellow circle. What is below the small black circle? a small black square or a big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) small black square (b) big yellow triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains a small black square, a small black circle, and a big black square. The small black square is below the small black circle. Block B is below Block A, and it contains a big yellow triangle touching the bottom edge. Since Block B is directly below Block A, the object directly below the small black circle in Block A is the small black square. The big yellow triangle touching the bottom edge is in Block B, so it cannot be directly below anything in Block A. Therefore, the answer is {a}. \boxed{a}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in Block A but makes a critical logical leap by assuming the answer must be within Block A, ignoring the possibility of objects in Block B being below the small black circle, which is one of the options provided in the question.

missing_context high

Explanation

The question asks what is below the small black circle, which could be an object in Block A or an object in Block B. The reasoning incorrectly concludes the answer based only on the relative positions within Block A, ignoring the possibility of objects in Block B being below it.

Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is below B. Block C is to the right of A. Block A has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B has one big black square and a big black circle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black circle. The big black circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big black square is to the right of the big black circle and the small black circle. And block C has one big black triangle. There is also a small yellow circle in this block. Near to and to the left of the big black triangle is the small yellow circle. The big black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the small yellow circle or the small black circle? (a) the small yellow circle (b) the small black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block A is below B. Block C is to the right of A. Block A has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B has one big black square and a big black circle. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black circle. The big black circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. The big black square is to the right of the big black circle and the small black circle. And block C has one big black triangle. There is also a small yellow circle in this block. Near to and to the left of the big black triangle is the small yellow circle. The big black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the small yellow circle or the small black circle? (a) the small yellow circle (b) the small black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A has two medium yellow squares. Block B is above Block A, and contains a big black square, a big black circle, and a small black circle. Block C is to the right of Block A and contains a big black triangle and a small yellow circle. Since the question asks what is above the medium yellow squares, and Block B is above Block A (which contains the medium yellow squares), we consider the objects in Block B. Block B contains a small black circle. The small yellow circle is in Block C, which is not above Block A. Therefore, the object above a medium yellow square is the small black circle. Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies that Block B is above Block A (where the medium yellow squares are located) and concludes that the small black circle (located in Block B) is above a medium yellow square, while correctly dismissing the small yellow circle (located in Block C).

(a) the medium black square that is in block B (b) the medium black square which is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Blocks A and B are below block C. The question asks what is below a medium yellow square. In Block B, the medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Since Block B is below Block C, the medium black square in Block C cannot be below the medium yellow square in Block B. Therefore, only the medium black square in Block B is below a medium yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

Statement
Since Block B is below Block C, the medium black square in Block C cannot be below the medium yellow square in Block B.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes that for one object to be below another, they must be in the same block, or that the relative vertical position of blocks (B below C) prevents an object in C from being below an object in B. The question asks which object is below a medium yellow square, referring to the objects described in the context, which are organized vertically within blocks. The relationship 'Blocks B and A are below C' describes the block positions relative to each other, but the question is about the internal structure described for the squares. The reasoning incorrectly uses the block hierarchy to dismiss the possibility of the black square in C being below the yellow square in B, which is irrelevant to the internal structure described for the squares.
Answer Span:
Since Block B is below Block C, the medium black square in Block C cannot be below the medium yellow square in Block B.
Reference/Question Span:
Blocks B and A are below C.

Full Question
We have three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. One medium yellow triangle, one medium blue triangle and one small blue square are in block A. Below a small black triangle is the medium yellow triangle. Below the small black triangle is a big yellow square. This object is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of the medium blue triangle which is near to the small blue square is the medium yellow triangle. Above and to the right of the small black triangle is the small blue square. Then, we have block B. It has a small yellow square and a medium yellow square. A medium blue circle is to the right of the medium yellow square and the small yellow square. Below the medium yellow square there is the small yellow square. Below both blocks A and B there is block C which contains one small black circle. Which object is above a small black circle? the small blue square or the big yellow object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small blue square (b) the big yellow object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. One medium yellow triangle, one medium blue triangle and one small blue square are in block A. Below a small black triangle is the medium yellow triangle. Below the small black triangle is a big yellow square. This object is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of the medium blue triangle which is near to the small blue square is the medium yellow triangle. Above and to the right of the small black triangle is the small blue square. Then, we have block B. It has a small yellow square and a medium yellow square. A medium blue circle is to the right of the medium yellow square and the small yellow square. Below the medium yellow square there is the small yellow square. Below both blocks A and B there is block C which contains one small black circle. Which object is above a small black circle? the small blue square or the big yellow object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small blue square (b) the big yellow object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium yellow triangle, a medium blue triangle, and a small blue square. A big yellow square is at the bottom of Block A. Block B contains a small yellow square and a medium yellow square. Block C, below both Block A and Block B, contains a small black circle. Since the big yellow square is at the bottom of Block A, and Block C (with the small black circle) is directly below Block A, the big yellow square is directly above the small black circle. The small blue square, however, is not directly above the small black circle, but rather higher up in Block A. Therefore, the object directly above the small black circle is the big yellow object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (Block A). Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the small black circle in Block C and correctly deduces which object in Block A is positioned above it based on the provided spatial relationships, leading to the correct choice.

Full Question

It is below the medium black square. Block B is to the left of block A. It has a medium black square. Below block B there is block C with two medium black squares and two other medium yellow squares in it. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two is medium black square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. It is below medium black square number two. Below medium black square number two and medium yellow square number one is medium black square number one. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block A? (a) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B, and C. Block A has a medium blue square and one medium black square. The medium blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Block B is to the left of block A. It has a medium black square. Below block B there is block C with two medium black squares and two other medium yellow squares in it. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two is medium black square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. It is below medium black square number two. Below medium black square number two and medium yellow square number one is medium black square number one. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block A? (a) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of Block A, and it contains a medium black square. Block A contains a medium black square and a medium blue square. Block C is below Block B and contains two medium black squares and two medium yellow squares. The question asks what is to the right of a medium black square. Since Block B is to the left of Block A and contains a medium black square, the objects in Block A are to the right of the medium black square in Block B. Therefore, the medium black square in Block A is to the right of the medium black square in Block B. Block C is below Block B, so the medium black square touching the bottom edge of Block C is not to the right of the medium black square in Block B. Thus, only the medium black square in Block A is to the right of a medium black square, specifically the one in Block B. Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the relative positions of Blocks A and B, but it fails to fully utilize the detailed positional information provided for the squares in Block C, which is necessary to evaluate option (a) correctly. It concludes that the black square touching the bottom edge of C is not to the right of the black square in B, but this conclusion is based on an incomplete analysis of the context regarding that specific square.

Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block B is below A. Block C is to the right of B. Block A has one medium black square and one medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Block B contains two medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below a medium yellow square. A medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium blue square number two there is the medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square , medium blue square number one and medium blue square number two. And block C contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the left of a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square that is in block B or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block B (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block B is below A. Block C is to the right of B. Block A has one medium black square and one medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Block B contains two medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below a medium yellow square. A medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium blue square number two there is the medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square , medium blue square number one and medium blue square number two. And block C contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the left of a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square that is in block B or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block B (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B contains two medium blue squares and a medium yellow square. Block C contains two medium yellow squares, one of which (medium yellow square number one) is touching the bottom edge. Since Block C is to the right of Block B, and the question asks what is to the left of a medium yellow square, we can infer the medium yellow square in question is the one in Block B. Therefore, since Block C is to the right of Block B, the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of Block C would be to the right of the medium yellow square in Block B, not to the left. The answer is the medium yellow square that is in block B. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly states the contents of Block B, claiming it contains a medium yellow square when the context assigns yellow squares to A and C. It also fails to correctly analyze the spatial relationships required to answer the final question, relying on an unsupported inference about what is to the left of what.

Question #565
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. Below block A there is block B with a big blue triangle, a big black triangle and one big blue square in it. Above and to the ri...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. Below block A there is block B with a big blue triangle, a big black triangle and one big blue square in it. Above and to the right of a medium black triangle there is the big blue triangle. The big black triangle is above the medium black triangle. It is to the left of and below the big blue square. Above block A there is block C with one small yellow square and a small black square in it. A big blue square is below the small yellow square. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. A big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and near to the small black square is the big blue square. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and below the small yellow square is the big blue triangle. What is below the circle? a big blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium black triangle? (a) big blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium black triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B and C. One big black circle is in block A. Below block A there is block B with a big blue triangle, a big black triangle and one big blue square in it. Above and to the right of a medium black triangle there is the big blue triangle. The big black triangle is above the medium black triangle. It is to the left of and below the big blue square. Above block A there is block C with one small yellow square and a small black square in it. A big blue square is below the small yellow square. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. A big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and near to the small black square is the big blue square. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of and below the small yellow square is the big blue triangle. What is below the circle? a big blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a medium black triangle? (a) big blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) medium black triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a big black circle. Block B is below Block A and contains a big blue triangle, a big black triangle, a big blue square, and a medium black triangle. Block C is above Block A. Since we're looking for what's below the circle in Block A, and Block B is below Block A, we need to consider the contents of Block B. Block B contains a big black triangle which is above a medium black triangle. Therefore, the object directly below the big black circle is the big black triangle which itself is above a medium black triangle. The answer is {B}. \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly assumes the contents of Block B and makes an unsupported leap about which object is directly below the circle in Block A, ignoring the ambiguity in the question itself.

Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B and C. There are one small black square, one small black circle and one big black square in block A. The small black square is below and near to the small black circle. This object is to the left of the big black square. Below block A we have block B with one big blue circle, one small blue circle and a medium blue triangle in it. The big blue circle is above the medium blue triangle which is near to a big yellow triangle. The small blue circle is above the big yellow triangle. The big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Near to and to the left of the medium blue triangle there is the small blue circle. To the left of block A there is block C. It contains one small yellow circle and a big black square. To the right of the big black square there is the small yellow circle. Which object is below a big black square? the small black square or the big shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the small black square (b) the big shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** In Block A, the big black square is located with the small black circle and the small black square, such that the small black square is below the small black circle. Block B is positioned below Block A. Block B contains a big yellow triangle touching the bottom edge. Since we are looking for what is below the big black square in Block A, and Block B is directly below Block A, the object below the big black square is the big yellow triangle which is touching the bottom edge of Block B. The small black square is below the small black circle within Block A, not below the big black square itself. Therefore, the answer is {b}. \boxed{b}

It incorrectly assumes the object below the big black square in Block A must be in Block B, and it incorrectly dismisses the first candidate ('the small black square') based on its relationship with another object in Block A, rather than checking the required condition.

(a) medium yellow square number two (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains two medium blue squares (number one and number two) and a medium black square at the bottom. Specifically, medium yellow square number one (the one touching the bottom edge of Block B) is directly above the medium blue squares. Medium yellow square number two is also above the medium blue squares, as it's in Block B above Block A. Therefore, both medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two are above a medium blue square. So the answer is {C}.

Therefore, since the blue square in Block B is above a black square and the blue square in Block C is above a black square, the answer is {C}. \boxed{c}

Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B, and C. Block A contains one medium yellow square. A medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It contains two medium blue squares. This block also contains one medium yellow square. This block also has a medium black square. This shape is below the medium yellow square and medium blue square number two.. Below the medium yellow square there is medium blue square number one. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below medium blue square number two which is below the medium yellow square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium yellow square and a medium black square below it, touching the bottom edge. Block B has a medium black square. Block C is to the left of Block A and contains a medium yellow square, two medium blue squares, and a medium black square. We're looking for what is to the right of a medium yellow square. Since Block C is to the left of Block A, the medium black square touching the bottom edge of Block A is to the right of the medium yellow square in Block C. Therefore, the medium black square touching the bottom edge of a block is to the right of a medium yellow square (in Block C). Also, Block C is to the left of Block A, so the black square at the bottom of Block A is to the right of the black square in Block C, but the black square in Block C is not to the right of the yellow square in Block A. The question asks what is to the right of a medium yellow square, so considering the yellow square in Block A, the answer is the medium black square touching the bottom edge. Therefore the answer is $\boxed{A}$.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects and their locations relative to the blocks. However, it makes assumptions about the horizontal positioning of objects *between* blocks (e.g., comparing the black square below A to the yellow square in C) that are not explicitly supported by the context, leading to speculative steps in the chain.

Detected Issues (2)

missing_context medium
Statement
Since Block C is to the left of Block A, the medium black square touching the bottom edge of Block A is to the right of the medium yellow square in Block C.
Explanation
The reasoning correctly establishes the relative positions of C and A, but it fails to specify *which* medium yellow square it is referring to when checking the 'to the right of' condition. The question asks which object is to the right of *a* medium yellow square. The reasoning jumps to comparing the black square below A with the yellow square in C without establishing the spatial relationship between them, which is not explicitly defined in the context.
Answer Span:
the medium black square touching the bottom edge of Block A is to the right of the medium yellow square in Block C
Reference/Question Span:
It is to the left of block A and to the right of block B. It contains two medium blue squares. This block also contains one medium yellow square.
missing_context medium
Statement
Also, Block C is to the left of Block A, so the black square at the bottom of Block A is to the right of the black square in Block C, but the black square in Block C is not to the right of the yellow square in Block A.
Explanation
The reasoning introduces a comparison between the black square in Block C and the yellow square in Block A, but the context does not provide enough information to definitively state the relative horizontal positions of the contents *within* Block A versus the contents *within* Block C, only the relative positions of the blocks themselves. This comparison is speculative based on the provided text.

the black square in Block C is not to the right of the yellow square in Block A
Reference/Question Span:

Full Question
There are two blocks. We call them A and B. Block A contains a small black square, one big blue circle and one medium black square. The small black square is above and near to the medium black square which is above, to the left of and near to a medium yellow square. The big blue circle is to the left of the medium yellow square. To the left of block A is block B. It has two small black circles. A big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a small yellow square. It also has one small black triangle and a medium blue circle. To the left of the medium blue circle is the small black triangle. Below the small yellow square there is the big yellow triangle. To the left of and below the small yellow square there is the small black triangle.. The medium blue circle is above small black circle number two. What is to the right of the small yellow square? a big blue circle or a thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big blue circle (b) thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are two blocks. We call them A and B. Block A contains a small black square, one big blue circle and one medium black square. The small black square is above and near to the medium black square which is above, to the left of and near to a medium yellow square. The big blue circle is to the left of the medium yellow square. To the left of block A is block B. It has two small black circles. A big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a small yellow square. It also has one small black triangle and a medium blue circle. To the left of the medium blue circle is the small black triangle. Below the small yellow square there is the big yellow triangle. To the left of and below the small yellow square there is the small black triangle. The medium blue circle is above small black circle number two. What is to the right of the small yellow square? a big blue circle or a thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big blue circle (b) thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a big blue circle, a medium black square, and a small black square. Block B is to the left of Block A and contains a small yellow square, a big yellow triangle touching the bottom edge, a small black triangle, and a medium blue circle. The big yellow triangle is below the small yellow square. The question asks what is to the right of the small yellow square. Since Block A is to the right of Block B, the objects in Block A, which are to the right of the small yellow square in Block B, include the big blue circle. The thing touching the bottom edge of Block B is the big yellow triangle, which is not to the right of the small yellow square, but below it. Therefore, only the big blue circle is to the right of the small yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in each block and the relative positions of the blocks. However, it incorrectly states the spatial relationship between the big yellow triangle and the small yellow square, contradicting the source text. Despite this error, the final conclusion about what is to the right of the small yellow square seems to follow the correct logic based on the block positions, but the internal reasoning step is flawed.

Medium yellow square number two is below medium yellow square number three. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number three. Above block A is block B with a medium black square in it. To the left of block A there is block C with a medium black square, one medium blue square and a medium yellow square in it. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is the medium blue square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square and the medium blue square. Which object is to the right of a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow square that is in block C? (a) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C is to the left of Block A. Block C contains a medium black square and a medium yellow square. Block A contains medium yellow squares, with number one touching the bottom edge. Since Block A is to the right of Block C, the medium yellow square (number one) at the bottom edge of Block A is to the right of the medium black square in Block C. Also, the medium yellow square in Block C cannot be to the right of the medium black square since they are both within Block C. Therefore, only the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of Block A is to the right of the medium black square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

Block B has two medium blue squares. This block also contains a medium black square. Below the medium black square there is medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the square which is below the medium black square. This shape is below the medium black square. And block C has one medium black square. It also has one medium yellow square. Below the medium black square is the medium yellow square. Which object is above a medium blue square? the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square that is in block A? (a) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has two medium yellow squares and one medium blue square, with yellow square one and yellow square two both below the blue square. Block B has two medium blue squares and a medium black square. Blue square two is below the black square, and blue square one is touching the bottom edge. The question asks what is above a medium blue square. In Block B, the medium black square is above medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is at the bottom, so nothing is above it. In Block A, the medium blue square is above both medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. The question specifically asks about the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of a block (medium blue square number one in Block B) and the medium blue square in Block A. Since nothing is above the blue square in Block B that is touching the bottom edge, and something is above the blue square in Block A. Thus, only the medium blue square that is in block A has an object above it. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$

However, it makes two factual assertions about the contents and relationships within Block A that are not explicitly supported or contradict the precise wording of the source context regarding the blue square's position relative to YS1.

Below block B there is block C with two medium black squares and two other medium yellow squares in it. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two is medium black square number two. Below medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. It is below medium black square number two. Below medium black square number two and medium yellow square number one is medium black square number one. Which object is below a medium black square? the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block A? (a) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium black square above a medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of Block A (It is below the medium black square). Block B is to the left of Block A and contains a medium black square. Block C is below Block B and contains two medium black squares and two medium yellow squares. Medium black square number one in Block C touches the bottom edge. The question asks what is below a medium black square. We are given two options: the medium black square touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square in Block A. The medium black square in Block A is above the medium blue square, which touches the bottom edge of Block A. Therefore, the medium black square in Block A is not below another medium black square. Block B's medium black square is above Block C, which contains medium black square number one touching the bottom edge. Thus, medium black square number one, which touches the bottom edge of Block C, is below the medium black square in Block B. The question asks which object is below *a* medium black square (implying any medium black square). Since medium black square number one in Block C is below the medium black square in Block B, medium black square number one (touching the bottom edge) is a valid answer. Final Answer: The final answer is \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain misinterprets the final question structure, leading to an incorrect analysis of option (b). It incorrectly assumes the question asks if the object *itself* is below another black square, rather than checking if the object described in option (b) is below *any* black square based on the context.

Above the big black square and the small yellow circle there is the small black square. To the right of and touching the big black square is the medium blue triangle. (a) the small black square (b) the big black circle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is above Block C and to the left of Block A. Block B contains two big yellow circles, with big yellow circle number two above big yellow circle number one. Block A contains a big black circle and two small yellow circles, with small yellow circle number one above both the big black circle and small yellow circle number two. Block C is below Block B and contains a small black square, a big yellow triangle, a small yellow circle, a medium blue triangle touching the bottom edge, and a big black square. Since Block C is directly below Block B (which contains the big yellow circles), the objects directly below the big yellow circles are the ones in Block C. Block C contains the small black square and the big black square. The question asks which of the options is below the big yellow circles. Thus, the small black square is below a big yellow circle, and the big black circle is in Block A, which is not below Block B. Therefore, the answer is the small black square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

Ground Truth Answer

Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block A contains a big black circle and one small blue circle. The big black circle is below a medium black triangle. Below the medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. The big black circle is above and near to the small blue circle. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow circle, a big black square and one small blue square in it. A medium black circle is to the right of the medium yellow circle and the small blue square. Above the big black square and the small blue square is the medium yellow circle. The medium black circle is above the big black square. To the right of block A and to the left of block B there is block C. It has one medium blue circle and a small blue circle. The medium blue circle is near to and to the left of a medium black square which is to the right of and below the small blue circle. Which object is to the right of a big black circle? the medium blue circle or the small blue square? (a) the medium blue circle (b) the small blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains a big black circle and a small blue circle. Block B contains a small blue square, a medium yellow circle and a big black square. Block C is located between Block A and Block B, and contains a medium blue circle. Since we want to determine what is to the right of the big black circle in Block A, and Block C is directly to the right of Block A, the object to the right of the big black circle is the medium blue circle in Block C. The small blue square is in Block B, which is to the right of Block C, hence not directly to the right of the big black circle. Therefore, only the medium blue circle is directly to the right of the big black circle. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an unsupported leap by assuming that because Block C is to the right of Block A, an object in Block C must be to the right of an object in Block A, without verifying the specific positional relationship between the big black circle and the medium blue circle. It ignores the fact that the positional information given relates to objects *within* blocks or relative positions of the blocks themselves, not the specific relative position between an object in A and an object in C.

It also contains a medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and the medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is medium blue square number two. Above block A there is block C which contains two medium yellow squares. This block also contains one medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium black square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium black square or the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium black square (b) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is below Block A, and Block B contains two medium blue squares and a medium yellow square. In Block B, medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge, and it's located below medium blue square number two and the medium yellow square. Block C is above Block A and contains a medium black square and two medium yellow squares. We're looking for what is below a medium yellow square. Since the medium yellow square is in Block B (which is under Block A), and medium blue square number one is below the medium yellow square in Block B, the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of a block is indeed below a medium yellow square. The answer is {B}. The medium black square is below a different medium yellow square (in Block C), not the one referred to in the question which is in Block B. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies that the medium blue square touching the bottom edge (in Block B) is below a medium yellow square (the one in Block B). However, it introduces a factual error by misplacing the medium black square relative to a yellow square in Block B, which is not supported by the text, and incorrectly dismisses the possibility of the black square being below *a* yellow square (the ones in Block C).

Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There is one medium yellow square in block A. Block B is below block A. It contains two medium blue squares. It also contains a medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and the medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is medium blue square number two. Above block A there is block C which contains two medium yellow squares. This block also contains one medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium black square. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square? (a) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There is one medium yellow square in block A. Block B is below block A. It contains two medium blue squares. It also contains a medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and the medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is medium blue square number two. Above block A there is block C which contains two medium yellow squares. This block also contains one medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium black square. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square? (a) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium yellow square. Block B, which is below Block A, has a medium yellow square and two medium blue squares. Block C, which is above Block A, has two medium yellow squares and a medium black square. In Block B, the medium yellow square is above medium blue square number two, and medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge. In Block C, the medium black square is above medium yellow square number two, which is above medium yellow square number one (touching the bottom edge). The question asks what is above a medium yellow square. In Block A, the medium yellow square has Block C above it, which contains the medium black square. Therefore, the medium black square is above a medium yellow square. In Block B, the medium yellow square is above medium blue square number two, and medium blue square number one is at the bottom. Therefore, the medium blue square touching the bottom edge is not above the medium yellow square, but below it. So, only the medium black square is above a medium yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning chain accurately interprets the spatial relationships described in the context to answer the question about what objects are above a medium yellow square.

Medium black square number one is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. There is also a medium blue square in this block. It is below medium black square number two. Below the blue shape which is below medium black square number two is medium black square number one. Below the medium blue square and the medium black square is the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? the thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block B? (a) the thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block B is to the left of block A and above block C. Block A contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. There is also a medium blue square in this block. It is below medium black square number two. Below the blue shape which is below medium black square number two is medium black square number one. Block B has a medium black square and a medium blue square. The medium black square is below the medium blue square. It also contains one medium yellow square.. Below the medium blue square and the medium black square is the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? the thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium black square that is in block B? (a) the thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium black square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium blue square, which is below medium black square number two and above medium black square number one (touching the bottom edge). Block B (which is to the left of Block A) contains a medium black square and a medium blue square. Since Block B is to the left of Block A, the objects in Block B are to the left of the objects in Block A. Therefore, the medium black square in Block B is to the left of the medium blue square in Block A. The object touching the bottom edge of Block A, which is medium black square number one, cannot be to the left of the medium blue square in Block A because it's in the same block and below it. So, only the medium black square in Block B is to the left of the medium blue square in Block A. \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relative positions of the objects based on the block locations and then evaluates the two options provided in the question against the target object (a medium blue square). The reasoning implicitly focuses on the medium blue square in Block A as the reference point, which is necessary to evaluate the options provided in the multiple-choice question.

Block B has a small yellow triangle, one big blue circle and a big black circle. The small yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow triangle is above the big blue circle. It is below and to the right of the big black circle. And block C contains two medium yellow circles. Medium yellow circle number one is above, to the left of and near to medium yellow circle number two. This block also has a small yellow circle. What is to the left of the small blue circle? a medium yellow circle or a small yellow triangle which is touching the right edge of a block? (a) medium yellow circle (b) small yellow triangle which is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of Block A. Block A contains a small blue circle. Block B contains a small yellow triangle, a big blue circle, and a big black circle. The small yellow triangle is touching the right edge of Block B. Block C, which is above Block B, contains two medium yellow circles. Medium yellow circle number two is below and to the right of medium yellow circle number one. Since Block B is to the left of Block A, and the small yellow triangle is touching the right edge of Block B, the small yellow triangle is to the left of the small blue circle (which is in Block A). Although Block C contains medium yellow circles, Block C is above Block B, not to its left, therefore, a medium yellow circle isn't to the left of the small blue circle. The small yellow triangle is the only object to the left of the small blue circle. Final Answer: \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the location of the small yellow triangle relative to the small blue circle (by linking B to A) but fails to properly evaluate the possibility of the medium yellow circle being to the left. It incorrectly dismisses the medium yellow circle based only on the relative positions of Block C and Block B, ignoring the complex spatial relationships described in the context that determine the final answer (a).

To the right of block A there is block C. It has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square in this block. There is also a medium black square in this block. It is below the medium blue square. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is in Block C, so it is to the right of the medium blue square in Block A. The medium yellow square in Block B is to the left of Block A, so it cannot be to the right of the medium blue square. Therefore, the answer is \boxed{B}.

The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is the medium blue square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square and the medium blue square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square which is in block C or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square which is in block C (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. Block A contains three medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number two is below medium yellow square number three. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number three. Above block A is block B with a medium black square in it. To the left of block A there is block C with a medium black square, one medium blue square and a medium yellow square in it. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is the medium blue square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square and the medium blue square. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square which is in block C or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square which is in block C (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains three medium yellow squares, stacked with square number one at the bottom, square number two in the middle, and square number three on top. Block C (to the left of A) contains a medium blue square and a medium yellow square with the medium blue square below the yellow one. The question asks what is below a medium yellow square. We need to consider both the squares in Block A and Block C. In Block A, medium yellow square number one touches the bottom edge, meaning nothing is below it. In Block C, the medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Therefore, only the medium blue square is below a medium yellow square. Since medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom, nothing is below it. Thus, the only correct option is (a) because the medium blue square is below the medium yellow square which is in block C. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies that the medium blue square is below the medium yellow square in Block C. However, it contains a minor misstatement regarding the stacking order in Block A (though the final conclusion derived from that fact is correct) and incorrectly frames the analysis of Block A's bottom square as a reason to dismiss it, rather than evaluating the options provided in the question.

Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is below blocks A and B. Block A contains one small yellow square. Block B contains a big blue triangle, one medium black circle and one medium yellow square. The medium black circle is to the right of a small black square and the medium yellow square. It is touching the right edge of this block. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below and to the left of the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium yellow triangle, a medium black circle and a small yellow square. To the left of and above the small yellow square is the medium black circle. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. Below the medium black circle is the medium yellow triangle. Which object is above a medium black circle? the medium yellow triangle or the small black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow triangle (b) the small black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is below blocks A and B. Block A contains one small yellow square. Block B contains a big blue triangle, one medium black circle and one medium yellow square. The medium black circle is to the right of a small black square and the medium yellow square. It is touching the right edge of this block. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below and to the left of the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium yellow triangle, a medium black circle and a small yellow square. To the left of and above the small yellow square is the medium black circle. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. Below the medium black circle is the medium yellow triangle. Which object is above a medium black circle? the medium yellow triangle or the small black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow triangle (b) the small black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B contains a medium black circle, a small black square touching the bottom edge, and a medium yellow square. Block C contains a medium black circle, a medium yellow triangle, and a small yellow square touching the right edge. Block C is below Blocks A and B. We're looking for what's above a medium black circle. Since the question specifies blocks A, B, and C, and since C is below A and B, when the question asks what is above a medium black circle, we're referring to the medium black circle in Block C, not the one in Block B. In Block C, the medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle. So the medium yellow triangle is not above the medium black circle. The small black square touching the bottom edge is in Block B, which is not above Block C, so it's not above the medium black circle in Block C. Since neither object is in a block above Block C, neither is above the medium black circle in Block C. Therefore, the answer is \boxed{D}.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes a critical, unsupported assumption that the question must refer only to the medium black circle in Block C because C is below A and B. This ignores the medium black circle in Block B. Furthermore, the reasoning fails to check the relative positions of the objects *within* Block B or Block C as described, leading to an incorrect conclusion based on the flawed premise.

There is also a small black circle in this block. Above and to the left of the small yellow square is the medium blue triangle. A medium black circle is far from, above and to the left of the small yellow square. Block B has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is to the left of and below medium yellow square number two. It also has one medium black circle. This object is below medium yellow square number two. It also contains a big blue square. Below and near to the big blue square is the medium black circle. To the left of the black object which is below the big blue square there is medium yellow square number one. Which object is below a big object? the medium black circle which is in block A or the thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium black circle which is in block A (b) the thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A is to the left of Block B. In Block A, the medium black circle is above and to the left of the small yellow square. In Block B, the big blue square has the medium black circle directly below it, and medium yellow square number one is to the left of the medium black circle. Nothing is specified as touching the bottom edge of either block. Since the question asks what is below a big object (the big blue square), the answer is the medium black circle in Block B. The medium black circle in Block A is not below anything big, and there is no object described as touching the bottom edge. Thus, the answer is {D}. The medium black circle in Block B is directly below the big blue square, making it below a big object. The other listed objects are not described as below anything big. \boxed{D}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain contains several factual errors (contradictions) regarding the placement of the medium black circle in Block A and the relationship between the medium black circle and the big blue square in Block B. It also dismisses one of the comparison options based on an assumption about missing information.

Question #3420
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A is to the right of B and block B is above C. Block A has one small yellow triangle, a small blue circle and a big blue circle. To the left of...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A is to the right of B and block B is above C. Block A has one small yellow triangle, a small blue circle and a big blue circle. To the left of the small blue circle which is to the right of the big blue circle is the small yellow triangle. The big blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above the big blue circle there is the small yellow triangle. Block B has a big yellow circle. And block C contains one small black square, a big yellow triangle and a big yellow circle. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black triangle. The small black square is to the left of and above the big yellow triangle which is to the right of the big yellow circle.. One small blue square is also in this block. It is near to and above the big yellow circle. Which object is to the left of a big blue circle? the small yellow triangle or the small blue square? (a) the small yellow triangle (b) the small blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
3
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block A is to the right of B and block B is above C. Block A has one small yellow triangle, a small blue circle and a big blue circle. To the left of the small blue circle which is to the right of the big blue circle is the small yellow triangle. The big blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above the big blue circle there is the small yellow triangle. Block B has a big yellow circle. And block C contains one small black square, a big yellow triangle and a big yellow circle. The big yellow triangle is touching the right edge of this block. This block also has a small black triangle. The small black square is to the left of and above the big yellow triangle which is to the right of the big yellow circle. One small blue square is also in this block. It is near to and above the big yellow circle. Which object is to the left of a big blue circle? the small yellow triangle or the small blue square? (a) the small yellow triangle (b) the small blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a small yellow triangle, a small blue circle, and a big blue circle. The small yellow triangle is to the left of the small blue circle, which is to the right of the big blue circle. This means the order from left to right in Block A is: small yellow triangle, big blue circle, small blue circle. Block C contains a small blue square. Since Block A is to the right of Block B and Block B is above Block C, Block C is not directly to the left of Block A. The small yellow triangle is to the left of the big blue circle within Block A. Therefore, the small yellow triangle is to the left of the big blue circle. Since the small blue square is in Block C and Block C is not to the left of Block A, the small blue square cannot be to the left of the big blue circle. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an unsupported assumption about the left-to-right ordering of objects within Block A and incorrectly dismisses the small blue square based on the irrelevant spatial relationship between blocks A, B, and C, failing to check if the small blue square is described as being spatially to the left of the big blue circle.

Statement
The small yellow triangle is to the left of the small blue circle, which is to the right of the big blue circle. This means the order from left to right in Block A is: small yellow triangle, big blue circle, small blue circle.
Explanation
The context states: 'To the left of the small blue circle which is to the right of the big blue circle is the small yellow triangle.' This implies the order is (Big Blue Circle) -> (Small Blue Circle) and (Small Yellow Triangle) is to the left of (Small Blue Circle). The context does not explicitly state the relative position of the small yellow triangle and the big blue circle, only that the small yellow triangle is to the left of the small blue circle, and the small blue circle is to the right of the big blue circle. The reasoning incorrectly deduces the order is 'small yellow triangle, big blue circle, small blue circle'. The context only guarantees that the small yellow triangle is to the left of the small blue circle, and the big blue circle is to the left of the small blue circle. The relative order of the small yellow triangle and the big blue circle is ambiguous based on the provided text, but the reasoning asserts a specific order that is not directly supported.
Answer Span:

Reference/Question Span:

missing_context high
Statement
Since Block A is to the right of Block B and Block B is above Block C, Block C is not directly to the left of Block A.
Explanation
The question asks which object is to the left of the big blue circle. The big blue circle is in Block A. The reasoning correctly identifies that the small yellow triangle is in Block A. However, it then dismisses the small blue square (which is in Block C) by reasoning about the relative positions of the blocks (A is right of B, B is above C). This spatial relationship between blocks (A, B, C) is irrelevant to the question, which asks about relative positions *within* the context of the objects described, specifically asking which object is to the left of the big blue circle (which is in Block A). The reasoning ignores the possibility that the small blue square might be described as being spatially to the left of the big blue circle, regardless of which block it is in, or it incorrectly assumes that objects in different blocks cannot satisfy the positional query.
Answer Span:
Since Block A is to the right of Block B and Block B is above Block C, Block C is not directly to the left of Block A. The small yellow triangle is to the left of the big blue circle within Block A. Therefore, the small yellow triangle is to the left of the big blue circle. Since the small blue square is in Block C and Block C is not to the left of Block A, the small blue square cannot be to the left of the big blue circle.
Reference/Question Span:
Which object is to the left of a big blue circle? the small yellow triangle or the small blue square?

Full Question

This object is below a medium black square. Block B contains two medium blue squares. It also contains a medium black square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium black square there is medium blue square number two. Below medium blue square number two and the medium black square there is medium blue square number one. And block C has two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below a medium yellow square. Below the medium yellow square is medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is below the medium black square number two. Which object is above a medium black square? the medium black square that is in block A or the medium black square that is in block B? (a) the medium black square that is in block A (b) the medium black square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them

Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Blocks B and C are below A. Block A contains a medium blue square. The medium blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below a medium black square. Block B contains two medium blue squares. It also contains a medium black square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium black square there is medium blue square number two. Below medium blue square number two and the medium black square there is medium blue square number one. And block C has two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below a medium yellow square. Below the medium yellow square is medium black square number two. Medium black square number one is below the medium black square number two. Which object is above a medium black square? the medium black square that is in block A or the medium black square that is in block B? (a) the medium black square that is in block A (b) the medium black square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium black square above the medium blue square. Block B also has a medium black square, which is above medium blue square number two and above medium blue square number one (which is touching the bottom). Since the question asks what is above a medium black square, and both Block A's black square and Block B's black square have objects above them, both fulfill the criteria. Block A's black square is above the blue square, which is above nothing. Since B and C are below A, then both A's black square and B's black square have items above them. The answer is {C}.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain contains multiple direct contradictions regarding the spatial relationship between the black square and the blue square in Block A. It also misuses the context about the relative positions of blocks A, B, and C to justify its claims about what is above the black squares.

**Reformatted Question:** We have three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. There are three medium black squares in block A. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number three there is medium black square number two. A medium yellow square is also in this block. This object is below medium black square number three. It is below the black object which is below medium black square number three. Below medium black square number three there is medium black square number one. It is below medium black square number two. Above block A there is block B which has two medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two. To the right of block A there is block C which has one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? medium black square number two or the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium black square number two (b) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains three medium black squares and one medium yellow square. Medium black square number one touches the bottom edge. Block B is above Block A and has two medium blue squares. Block C is to the right of Block A and has one medium blue square. Since Block A is to the left of Block C, the objects in Block A are to the left of the medium blue square in Block C. Both medium black square number two and medium black square number one (touching the bottom edge) are in Block A. Therefore, both are to the left of the medium blue square in Block C. Final Answer: \boxed{C}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relevant spatial relationships (Block A is to the left of Block C) and uses this to answer the question about which objects in Block A are to the left of the blue square in Block C. No contradictions or missing context were found.

The medium yellow square is below medium blue square number two. It is below medium blue square number one which is below medium blue square number two. Block B is below block A. It has one medium yellow square. Finally, we have block C which is above block A. It has a medium blue square and a medium black square. There is also one medium yellow square in this block. The medium blue square is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square is the medium black square. Below the medium black square is the medium blue square. It is below the medium yellow square. Which object is above a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains two medium blue squares (number one and number two) and a medium yellow square at the bottom edge. Block B is below Block A, and Block C is above Block A. Block C contains a medium yellow square, a medium black square, and a medium blue square at its bottom edge. The question asks what is above a medium yellow square. In Block A, the blue squares are above the medium yellow square. In Block C, the medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Thus, only the medium yellow square at the bottom edge of Block A has something above it. The answer is {B}.
Overall Quality: poor

It incorrectly concludes that only the yellow square in Block A has something above it, failing to properly assess the yellow square in Block C based on the provided relative positions.

Ground Truth Answer

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have two blocks, A and B. Block A contains one small yellow circle, a big blue circle and a small black circle. The small yellow circle is below the big blue circle. The big blue circle is to the left of and above the small black circle. The small black circle is touching the right edge of this block. To the right of block A we have block B. It contains a medium yellow square, one big blue triangle and one small black triangle. This block also has a medium yellow circle. Above the small black triangle and the big blue triangle is a medium black triangle. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. The small black triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the right of the medium yellow circle and the small black triangle is the big blue triangle. What is to the right of the small yellow circle? a small black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a big blue triangle? (a) small black triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) big blue triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains the small yellow circle, the big blue circle, and the small black circle. Block B, which is to the right of Block A, contains a small black triangle touching the bottom edge and a big blue triangle. Since Block B is to the right of Block A, both the big blue triangle and the small black triangle (which is touching the bottom edge of Block B) are to the right of the small yellow circle (which is in Block A). Therefore, the answer is {C}.
Overall Quality: poor

It fails to use the specific positional information given for the small yellow circle relative to other objects in Block A, which is necessary to determine what is immediately to its right.

Block C has two medium yellow squares. Below a medium blue square there is medium yellow square number one. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Ground Truth Answer

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block B is to the left of A. Block A is below C. Block A has one medium black square and a medium blue square. This block also has one medium yellow square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the medium blue square and the medium yellow square. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Block B has two medium blue squares. Below medium blue square number two there is medium blue square number one. Block C has two medium yellow squares. Below a medium blue square there is medium yellow square number one. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the left of a medium yellow square? medium blue square number one or the medium blue square which is in block C? (a) medium blue square number one (b) the medium blue square which is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of Block A. Block B contains two medium blue squares, with medium blue square number one below medium blue square number two. Block C contains two medium yellow squares and one medium blue square, with medium yellow square number two below the blue square and medium yellow square number one below square number two, touching the bottom edge. Block A is below Block C and contains a medium yellow square. Since B is to the left of A, the blue squares in B are to the left of the yellow square in A. This means medium blue square number one is to the left of a medium yellow square (the one in Block A). Since Block A is below Block C, the blue square in Block C cannot be to the left of the yellow squares also in Block C. It is above them. So, the blue square in Block C is not to the left of a yellow square. Therefore, only medium blue square number one is to the left of a medium yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{a}
Overall Quality: poor
