Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A contains one medium yellow square. To the right of block A we have block B. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a medium blue square. Medium black square number two is below the medium blue square. Below the medium blue square and medium black square number two there is medium black square number one. Finally, there is block C which is below block A. It has three medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and medium blue square number three. Medium blue square number two is below medium blue square number three. A medium yellow square is below medium blue square number two and medium blue square number one. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium blue square which is in block B or medium blue square number one? (a) the medium blue square which is in block B (b) medium blue square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** We have three blocks, A, B, and C. Block A contains one medium yellow square. To the right of block A we have block B. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a medium blue square. Medium black square number two is below the medium blue square. Below the medium blue square and medium black square number two there is medium black square number one. Finally, there is block C which is below block A. It has three medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and medium blue square number three. Medium blue square number two is below medium blue square number three. A medium yellow square is below medium blue square number two and medium blue square number three. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium blue square which is in block B or medium blue square number one? (a) the medium blue square which is in block B (b) medium blue square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains a medium yellow square. Block B is to the right of Block A and contains a medium blue square. Block C is below Block A and contains medium blue square number one. Since the question asks what is to the right of a medium yellow square, and Block A contains the medium yellow square, we need to find the object in the block to the right of Block A, which is Block B. Block B contains a medium blue square. Thus, the medium blue square which is in block B, is to the right of the medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one, located in Block C (below Block A), is not to the right of the medium yellow square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the medium yellow square (Block A) and deduces that the object to its right must be in Block B, which is explicitly stated to be to the right of Block A. It correctly evaluates the options based on the context.

Question #349
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is to the right of A. Block B is to the left of C. Block A contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bo...
1 issue
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is to the right of A. Block B is to the left of C. Block A contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Block B has three medium black squares. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number one. It is below the medium black square number two. And block C contains a medium yellow square and one medium blue square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the medium blue square. Which object is below a medium black square? medium black square number three or the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium black square number three (b) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is to the right of A. Block B is to the left of C. Block A contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Block B has three medium black squares. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number one. It is below the medium black square number two. And block C contains a medium yellow square and one medium blue square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the medium blue square. Which object is below a medium black square? medium black square number three or the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium black square number three (b) the medium black square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of C and Block C is to the right of Block A. Thus, the order of blocks from left to right is B, A, C. Block B contains three medium black squares: number one, two, and three. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge. Medium black square number two is below number three and number one is below number two, thus the order from top to bottom is three, two, and one. The question asks what is below a medium black square. Since medium black square number two is below medium black square number three and medium black square number one (which is touching the bottom edge) is below medium black square number two, both medium black square number three and the medium black square touching the bottom edge have a medium black square below them. Therefore, the answer is {C}.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the block order but misinterprets or misrepresents the vertical stacking order of the black squares in Block B, leading to a flawed justification for the final conclusion, although the final conclusion itself might coincidentally align with the correct interpretation of the question asked.

Detected Issues (1)

contradiction medium
Statement
Medium black square number two is below number three and number one is below number two, thus the order from top to bottom is three, two, one.
Explanation
The source states: 'Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number one. It is below the medium black square number two.' This means 3 is above 2, and 1 is below 2 (so 2 is above 1). The order top to bottom is 3, 2, 1. The reasoning chain correctly states the order is three, two, one, but the description of the relationship between 1 and 2 contradicts the source's description of 1 being below 2, and 2 being below 3.
Answer Span:
Medium black square number two is below number three and number one is below number two, thus the order from top to bottom is three, two, one.
Reference/Question Span:
Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number one. It is below the medium black square number two.
Question #1845

2 issues
Full Question
We have three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. There are two medium black squares in block A. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium black square number two is below a medium yellow square. Medium black square number one is below the medium yellow square. This object is below medium black square number two. Above block A we have block B with two medium blue squares in it. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium blue square number two. It also contains one medium yellow square. It is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is below the yellow object which is below medium blue square number two. Below block A there is block C with one medium yellow square in it. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or the medium yellow square that is in block A? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) the medium yellow square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. There are two medium black squares in block A. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium black square number two is below a medium yellow square. Medium black square number one is below the medium yellow square. This object is below medium black square number two. Above block A we have block B with two medium blue squares in it. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium blue square number two. It also contains one medium yellow square. It is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is below the yellow object which is below medium blue square number two. Below block A there is block C with one medium yellow square in it. Which object is below a medium yellow square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or the medium yellow square that is in block A? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) the medium yellow square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains two medium black squares and a medium yellow square. Medium black square number one is at the bottom edge of Block A, with the medium yellow square above it, and medium black square number two above that. Block B is above Block A, and Block C is below Block A. Block C contains a medium yellow square. Since the question asks what is below the medium yellow square (in Block A), the answer is the medium black square touching the bottom edge of Block A. This medium black square is in Block A, not Block C. The medium yellow square in Block C is below Block A as a whole, not specifically below the medium yellow square within Block A. Therefore, the answer is {B}. \boxed{b}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain contains a factual contradiction regarding the vertical stacking order of squares in Block A and fundamentally misinterprets the final question by ignoring the required comparison between the objects below the yellow squares in Block A and Block C.

Medium black square number two is below a medium yellow square. Medium black square number one is below the medium yellow square.' The medium yellow square in Block B has a medium blue square number two above it. The medium yellow square in Block A has medium black square number two above it. Thus, only medium blue square number two, which is in Block B, is above a medium yellow square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$

The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Block B has two medium blue squares. Below medium blue square number two there is medium blue square number one. Block C has two medium yellow squares. Below a medium blue square there is medium yellow square number one. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the right of a medium blue square? the medium blue square that is in block A or medium blue square number one? (a) the medium blue square that is in block A (b) medium blue square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them

This block also has one medium yellow square. The medium black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the medium blue square and the medium yellow square. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square. Block B has two medium blue squares. Below medium blue square number two there is medium blue square number one. Block C has two medium yellow squares. Below a medium blue square there is medium yellow square number one. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the right of a medium blue square? the medium blue square that is in block A or medium blue square number one? (a) the medium blue square that is in block A (b) medium blue square number one (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the left of Block A. Block B contains two medium blue squares, with medium blue square number one below medium blue square number two. Block A contains a medium blue square. Therefore, the medium blue square in Block A is to the right of medium blue square number one in Block B. The medium blue square in Block A is to the right of a medium blue square (specifically, the top medium blue square) in Block B. Block A also contains a medium black square and medium yellow square. Block C has two medium yellow squares, and it is located above Block A. This information doesn't impact the position of the medium blue squares. Final Answer: The final answer is \boxed{A}

Full Question
We have two blocks, A and B. Block A is to the left of B. Block A contains one small blue triangle, a big blue circle and one medium blue triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. This object is near to, above and to the right of the medium blue triangle. Block B contains two medium blue triangles. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. A big yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of medium blue triangle number two is a small yellow circle. Below medium blue triangle number two is a big blue triangle.. To the left of medium blue triangle number one and the big blue triangle there is the big yellow square. It is to the right of the yellow shape which is to the left of medium blue triangle number two. What is to the right of the small blue triangle? a big blue triangle or a yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big blue triangle (b) yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** We have two blocks, A and B. Block A is to the left of B. Block A contains one small blue triangle, a big blue circle and one medium blue triangle. The big blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. This object is near to, above and to the right of the medium blue triangle. Block B contains two medium blue triangles. Medium blue triangle number one is touching the right edge of this block. A big yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. To the left of medium blue triangle number two is a small yellow circle. Below medium blue triangle number two is a big blue triangle. To the left of medium blue triangle number one and the big blue triangle there is the big yellow square. It is to the right of the yellow shape which is to the left of medium blue triangle number two. What is to the right of the small blue triangle? a big blue triangle or a yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big blue triangle (b) yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** The small blue triangle is in Block A. Block B is to the right of Block A. Block B contains two medium blue triangles, a big blue triangle, and a big yellow square touching the bottom edge. Since Block B is to the right of Block A, both the big blue triangle and the big yellow square are to the right of the small blue triangle in Block A. Thus, the answer is {C}. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{C}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes several unsupported assumptions about the contents of Block B and incorrectly concludes the answer based on general block positioning rather than checking the specific positional constraints required by the question (what is to the right of the small blue triangle).

Full Question

This block also has a medium black square. This block also contains one medium yellow square. This object is below medium blue square number two. It is below the medium black square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium blue square number two , the medium yellow square and the medium black square. Block C has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square in this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two and the medium blue square is medium yellow square number one. Which object is below a black shape? the medium blue square that is in block C or the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium blue square that is in block C (b) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is to the left of and C is to the right of B. Block A has a medium yellow square. Block B contains two medium blue squares. This block also has a medium black square. This block also contains one medium yellow square. This object is below medium blue square number two. It is below the medium black square. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium blue square number two , the medium yellow square and the medium black square. Block C has two medium yellow squares. There is also a medium blue square in this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Below medium yellow square number two and the medium blue square is medium yellow square number one. Which object is below a black shape? the medium blue square that is in block C or the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium blue square that is in block C (b) the medium blue square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is between Block A and Block C. Block B contains two medium blue squares, a medium black square, and a medium yellow square. The arrangement within Block B is such that the medium black square is on top, followed by medium blue square number two, then the medium yellow square, and finally, medium blue square number one touching the bottom edge (This order is confirmed by the fact that the yellow square is below both blue square two and the black square, and blue square one is below all three). Since we are looking for what is below the black shape in Block B, and medium blue square one is at the bottom edge of Block B, the answer is {B}. \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain focuses exclusively on Block B and fails to analyze the contents or location of Block C, which is necessary to evaluate the first option in the multiple-choice question. It also makes an assumption about the relative positions of A, B, and C. Crucially, it ignores the context needed to determine if the blue square in C is below a black shape.

Full Question

It is below medium yellow square number three. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below medium yellow square number three and the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number three. Block B contains two medium yellow squares. One medium blue square is also in this block. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium blue square and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Block C contains one medium yellow square. Which object is below a medium square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or medium yellow square number three? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) medium yellow square number three (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
3
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A is to the right of C and block C is above B. Block A contains three medium yellow squares. It also contains a medium black square. It is below medium yellow square number three. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below medium yellow square number three and the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number three. Block B contains two medium yellow squares. One medium blue square is also in this block. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium blue square and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium blue square. Block C contains one medium yellow square. Which object is below a medium square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or medium yellow square number three? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) medium yellow square number three (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C is above Block B. Block C contains one medium yellow square. Block A is to the right of Block C. Block A contains three medium yellow squares and a medium black square. Medium yellow square number three is above medium yellow square number two and the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one (in Block A) is touching the bottom edge. The question asks what is below a medium square (in Block C). Since Block B is below Block C, and Block A is to the right of, not below, Block C, only Block B can be below Block C. Therefore, the object below the medium yellow square in Block C is something in Block B. Since medium yellow square number three is in Block A and Block A is not below Block C, medium yellow square number three cannot be below the medium yellow square in Block C. The medium yellow square in Block C has objects in Block B below it. The answer is \boxed{A}.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain fundamentally misinterprets the final question, leading to an irrelevant line of deduction about what is below the square in Block C, rather than evaluating the two options provided in the question against the condition 'is below a medium square'.

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction medium
Statement
Block C is above Block B.
Explanation
The context states 'block C is above B', which is consistent. However, the reasoning then pivots to assume the question is asking what is below the square in C, which is not the question asked.
Answer Span:
Block C is above Block B.
Reference/Question Span:
block C is above B
missing_context high
Statement
The question asks what is below a medium square (in Block C).
Explanation
The actual question is: 'Which object is below a medium square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or medium yellow square number three?' This is a choice between two specific objects being below *some* medium square, not asking what is below the square in Block C.
Answer Span:

Reference/Question Span:

Full Question
There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block A has one medium blue square. Block B is above block A. It contains one medium blue triangle, one big yellow square and one small yellow square. A big blue circle is also in this block. The small yellow square is above the big blue circle. The medium blue triangle is below the small yellow square. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is near to the big blue circle. The big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. It is below the small shape which is above the big blue circle. It is above the big blue circle. To the left of block B there is block C which has one big black circle. There is also one medium black circle in this block. The big black circle is to the left of and near to the medium black circle. Which object is below a medium blue object? the medium black circle or the square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium black circle (b) the square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
3
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block A has one medium blue square. Block B is above block A. It contains one medium blue triangle, one big yellow square and one small yellow square. A big blue circle is also in this block. The small yellow square is above the big blue circle. The medium blue triangle is below the small yellow square. It is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is near to the big blue circle. The big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. It is below the small shape which is above the big blue circle. It is above the big blue circle. To the left of block B there is block C which has one big black circle. There is also one medium black circle in this block. The big black circle is to the left of and near to the medium black circle. Which object is below a medium blue object? the medium black circle or the square that is touching the right edge of a block? (a) the medium black circle (b) the square that is touching the right edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is above Block A, and Block B contains a medium blue triangle. Since Block B is above Block A, and Block A contains a medium blue square, the medium blue triangle is above the medium blue square. Therefore, the medium blue square is below the medium blue triangle. This blue square is in Block A. The big yellow square is in Block B and is touching the right edge of Block B. The medium black circle is in Block C, which is to the left of Block B. Therefore, the medium black circle cannot be below a medium blue object in Block B or A. The big yellow square, however, is in Block B and is, therefore, below the medium blue triangle. Final Answer: The final answer is \boxed{B}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies one potential answer (the square touching the right edge, which is the big yellow square in B, below the medium blue triangle in B) but incorrectly dismisses the other option (the medium black circle) based on an unwarranted assumption about location relative to the medium blue objects.

Full Question

This block also has a small black square. There is also one small blue square in this block. The big blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the small blue square. The medium blue square is below and to the right of the small black square. This shape is above and to the left of the big black circle. Block B contains a medium black square. Block C contains one small black square, one small yellow triangle and one small blue triangle. Below the small blue triangle and the small yellow triangle there is the small black square. The small yellow triangle is near to the small blue triangle. What is to the right of the small blue square? a object that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a small black square? (a) object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) small black square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block B is to the left of C and block C is to the right of A. Block A contains a medium blue square, one big blue circle, and a big black circle. This block also has a small black square. There is also one small blue square in this block. The big blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the small blue square. The medium blue square is below and to the right of the small black square. This shape is above and to the left of the big black circle. Block B contains a medium black square. Block C contains one small black square, one small yellow triangle, and one small blue triangle. Below the small blue triangle and the small yellow triangle there is the small black square. The small yellow triangle is near to the small blue triangle. What is to the right of the small blue square? a object that is touching the bottom edge of a block or a small black square? (a) object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) small black square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: We know that Block A contains a small blue square, a small black square, and a big blue circle. The small blue square is above the big blue circle, which is touching the bottom edge of Block A. The small black square is above and to the left of the medium blue square. Since we want to know what is to the right of the small blue square, and we know that the small black square is to the left of the medium blue square, while the big blue circle is below the small blue square, the correct answer is the small black square. The medium blue square is to the right and below the small black square. The big blue circle is below the small blue square. Thus, to the right of the small blue square is the small black square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain fails to correctly deduce the answer from the provided spatial relationships. It makes an unsupported leap by concluding the small black square is to the right of the small blue square based on relationships involving the medium blue square and the big blue circle, without establishing the necessary direct spatial link between the small blue square and the small black square. The context only states the medium blue square is below/right of the small black square, and the big blue circle is below the small blue square.

This is a direct restatement of the relationship, but the reasoning chain uses this to establish a relationship that is not directly used to answer the final question about what is to the right of the small blue square, and it misrepresents the relative positions in the subsequent step.

However, the question asks what is to the right of the small blue square, and the context only specifies the relationship between the medium blue square and the small black square relative to *each other*, and the big blue circle relative to the small blue square. Full Question

Below medium black square number three there is medium black square number one. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. There is also one medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium black square number one is the medium yellow square. This object is below medium black square number two and medium black square number three. Which object is below a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is in block A or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block A (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them

1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are two blocks. Let's call them A and B. One medium blue square, a medium black square and a medium yellow square are in block A. Below the medium yellow square is the medium black square. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square and the medium black square. Below block A is block B. It has three medium black squares. Below medium black square number three there is medium black square number one. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. There is also one medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium black square number one is the medium yellow square. This object is below medium black square number two and medium black square number three. Which object is below a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is in block A or the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block A (b) the medium yellow square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: In Block A, the medium black square is below the medium yellow square, and the medium blue square is below both of those. Block B is below Block A, and contains three medium black squares. Since Block B is below Block A, some of the medium black squares in Block B are below the medium black square in Block A. The medium yellow square in Block B is below the medium black squares in Block B. Therefore, the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of Block B is below a medium black square (specifically, those in Block B). The medium yellow square in Block A is above the medium black square in Block A and is not below any medium black square. Therefore, the answer is {b}. \boxed{b}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies that the yellow square in Block B is below black squares in Block B based on the context. However, it introduces an unsupported spatial inference about the relationship between the squares in Block A and Block B, which is not explicitly stated in the context, leading to a potentially flawed intermediate step, even though the final conclusion aligns with the explicit facts about Block B.

Reformatted Question: There are two blocks, A and B. Block A has a big black square, a small black square and one medium black square. The small black square is above the medium black square. Near to and to the right of the small black square there is the big black square. Block B is to the right of block A. It contains one medium black triangle, one small black square and one big yellow square. A medium yellow triangle is also in this block. The big yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. Near to the big yellow square and the small black square there is the medium black triangle. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium black triangle is to the right of the medium yellow triangle. Which object is to the left of a medium black triangle? the thing that is touching the right edge of a block or the black thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the thing that is touching the right edge of a block (b) the black thing that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is to the right of Block A. Block B contains the medium black triangle, the big yellow square touching the right edge, and the small black square touching the bottom edge. Since both the big yellow square and the small black square are in Block B along with the medium black triangle, and are described as being near it, they are both to its left. Therefore, both the big yellow square (touching the right edge) and the small black square (touching the bottom edge) are to the left of the medium black triangle. The answer is \boxed{C}.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in Block B and their properties relevant to the options. However, it makes an unsubstantiated assumption about the relative positioning (left/right) of the small black square relative to the medium black triangle based only on the proximity statement, which is a missing context error regarding spatial reasoning.

The medium black triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow triangle is above and to the left of the big black square. Block B is above block A. It contains one small black square, one medium yellow circle and one big black triangle. This block also has a small blue square. Above the big black triangle is the medium yellow circle. A small blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above the small blue circle and the big black triangle there is the small black square. What is below the small blue square? a big black square or a small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big black square (b) small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have two blocks. We call them A and B. There are one small yellow triangle, a big black square and a medium black triangle in block A. The big black square is touching the right edge of this block. It is above the medium black triangle. The small yellow triangle is touching the top edge of this block. The medium black triangle is touching the right edge of this block. The small yellow triangle is above and to the left of the big black square. Block B is above block A. It contains one small black square, one medium yellow circle and one big black triangle. This block also has a small blue square. Above the big black triangle is the medium yellow circle. A small blue circle is touching the bottom edge of this block. Above the small blue circle and the big black triangle there is the small black square. What is below the small blue square? a big black square or a small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) big black square (b) small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a small yellow triangle at the top, a big black square on the right edge above a medium black triangle, which is also on the right edge. Block B, which is above Block A, contains a small blue square, a small blue circle touching the bottom edge, a big black triangle, a small black square, and a medium yellow circle. The small black square is above the small blue circle and the big black triangle. The medium yellow circle is above the big black triangle. Since Block B is above Block A and the small blue square is in Block B, the object directly below the small blue square would be in Block A. The big black square is in Block A. Therefore, the big black square is below the small blue square. The small blue circle is touching the bottom edge of Block B, not Block A, so it cannot be below the small blue square. The answer is \boxed{A}.
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the location of the big black square in Block A. However, it incorrectly dismisses option (b) by assuming the object below the small blue square must be in Block A, ignoring that both objects could be in Block B, and the small blue circle fits the description in option (b) and is below the small blue square within Block B.

missing_context medium
Statement

Explanation
The reasoning correctly identifies that the small blue circle is in Block B and touches the bottom edge of Block B. However, the question asks if the object below the small blue square is 'a big black square or a small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block?'. The small object touching the bottom edge of a block *could* be the small blue circle (which touches the bottom edge of Block B). By concluding it 'cannot be below the small blue square' based on it being in Block B, the reasoning ignores the possibility that the small blue circle *is* the 'small object that is touching the bottom edge of a block' mentioned in option (b), and since Block B is above Block A, the small blue circle is indeed below the small blue square (as they are both in Block B, and the small blue circle is at the bottom edge of B, while the small blue square is somewhere above it in B). The reasoning incorrectly dismisses option (b) based on spatial separation between blocks when the question is phrased generally about the objects.
Answer Span:

**Reformatted Question:** There are two blocks. We call them A and B. Block A is to the left of B. Block A contains one medium blue triangle and a small yellow square. A medium black circle is far from, above and to the left of the small yellow square. Block B has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is to the left of and below medium yellow square number two. It also has one medium black circle. This object is below medium yellow square number two. It also contains a big blue square. Below and near to the big blue square is the medium black circle. To the left of the black object which is below the big blue square there is medium yellow square number one. What is to the left of the blue square? a medium blue triangle or a medium black circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium blue triangle (b) medium black circle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A is to the left of Block B. Block A contains a medium blue triangle. Block B contains two medium yellow squares, a medium black circle, and a big blue square. Medium yellow square number one is to the left of the medium black circle (which is below the big blue square). Since the question asks what is to the left of the big blue square, and medium yellow square number one is to its left, the answer is not a medium black circle touching the bottom edge. Because Block A is to the left of Block B and Block A contains the medium blue triangle, the medium blue triangle is to the left of the big blue square. Therefore, the answer is {A}. \boxed{A}

Ground Truth Answer

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B and C. Block A contains a big black circle and one small blue circle. The big black circle is below a medium black triangle. Below the medium black triangle there is the small blue circle. The big black circle is above and near to the small blue circle. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow circle, a big black square and one small blue square in it. A medium black circle is to the right of the medium yellow circle and the small blue square. Above the big black square and the small blue square is the medium yellow circle. The medium black circle is above the big black square. To the right of block A and to the left of block B there is block C. It has one medium blue circle and a small blue circle. The medium blue circle is near to and to the left of a medium black square which is to the right of and below the small blue circle. What is to the left of the big black square? a medium blue circle or a yellow object? (a) medium blue circle (b) yellow object (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B contains the big black square, a medium yellow circle, and a small blue square. Block C is to the left of Block B and to the right of Block A. Block C contains a medium blue circle and a small blue circle. Since Block C is directly to the left of Block B, the object directly to the left of the big black square (which is in Block B) is the medium blue circle (in Block C). The yellow object (medium yellow circle) is above the big black square (within the same Block B). Therefore, the answer is {A}. \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: fair

Detected Issues (1)

missing_context medium
Statement

Explanation
The reasoning assumes Block C is *directly* to the left of Block B, and that the object immediately to the left of the big black square must be in Block C. The context only states Block C is 'To the right of block A and to the left of block B'. It does not specify the internal alignment or adjacency between objects in C and objects in B, especially not that the medium blue circle is *directly* to the left of the big black square.
Answer Span:
Since Block C is directly to the left of Block B, the object directly to the left of the big black square (which is in Block B) is the medium blue circle (in Block C)
Reference/Question Span:
To the right of block A and to the left of block B there is block C.
Question #1296
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block B is above blocks C and A. Block A has a small yellow square and one big yellow triangle. The small yellow square is below the big yellow triangle. Block B ha...
2 issues
Full Question
There are three blocks, A, B and C. Block B is above blocks C and A. Block A has a small yellow square and one big yellow triangle. The small yellow square is below the big yellow triangle. Block B has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is above a big blue triangle. It also contains a big blue square. It is above and to the right of the big blue triangle. Above and to the right of the big blue triangle there is medium yellow square number one. The big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. And block C has one medium yellow square and a big yellow circle. This block also has a medium black triangle. The medium yellow square is near to, to the right of and below the big yellow circle. Which object is above a yellow square? the triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the big blue square? (a) the triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Block B is above blocks C and A. Block A has a small yellow square and one big yellow triangle. The small yellow square is below the big yellow triangle. Block B has two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the right edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is above a big blue triangle. It also contains a big blue square. It is above and to the right of the big blue triangle. Above and to the right of the big blue triangle there is medium yellow square number one. The big blue triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. And block C has one medium yellow square and a big yellow circle. This block also has a medium black triangle. The medium yellow square is near to, to the right of and below the big yellow circle. Which object is above a yellow square? the triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the big blue square? (a) the triangle that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the big blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block B is above Block A. Block B contains medium yellow square number two above a big blue triangle, and a big blue square which is above and to the right of the big blue triangle. The big blue triangle touches the bottom edge of Block B. Since we are looking for what is above a yellow square, we focus on medium yellow square number two in Block B. The object directly above the big blue triangle (and therefore above medium yellow square number two) is the big blue square. The answer is \boxed{B}.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes an unsupported assumption about the vertical relationship between the big blue square and medium yellow square number two, leading to a conclusion based on flawed intermediate steps. It also slightly misrepresents the positional information given for Block B.

Detected Issues (2)

contradiction medium
Statement
Block B is above Block A.
Explanation
The context states Block B is above blocks C and A, but the reasoning chain implies a specific relationship between B and A that isn't the full context, and more importantly, it misses the crucial detail that B is above *both* A and C.
Answer Span:
Block B is above Block A.
Reference/Question Span:
Block B is above blocks C and A.
missing_context high
Statement
The object directly above the big blue triangle (and therefore above medium yellow square number two) is the big blue square.
Explanation
The reasoning assumes that because medium yellow square number two is above the big blue triangle, and the big blue square is also above and to the right of the big blue triangle, the big blue square must be directly above medium yellow square number two. The context only states that medium yellow square number two is above the big blue triangle, and the big blue square is above and to the right of the big blue triangle. It does not establish the vertical relationship between the big blue square and medium yellow square number two.
Answer Span:
The object directly above the big blue triangle (and therefore above medium yellow square number two) is the big blue square.
Reference/Question Span:

Question #350

1 issue
Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. One medium yellow square is in block A. Block B is below block A. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below a medium yellow square and medium black square number two. This block also contains one medium blue square. The medium blue square is below medium black square number one and medium black square number two. Below medium black square number two is the medium yellow square. To the left of block B there is block C with two medium yellow squares in it. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. One medium blue square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two there is the medium blue square. It is below medium yellow square number one. Which object is above a medium blue square? medium yellow square number one or the medium yellow square which is in block A? (a) medium yellow square number one (b) the medium yellow square which is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. One medium yellow square is in block A. Block B is below block A. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below a medium yellow square and medium black square number two. This block also contains one medium blue square. The medium blue square is below medium black square number one and medium black square number two. Below medium black square number two is the medium yellow square. To the left of block B there is block C with two medium yellow squares in it. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. One medium blue square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two there is the medium blue square. It is below medium yellow square number one. Which object is above a medium blue square? medium yellow square number one or the medium yellow square which is in block A? (a) medium yellow square number one (b) the medium yellow square which is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B is below Block A. Block A contains a medium yellow square. Block B contains two medium black squares and a medium blue square. The arrangement in Block B is: medium yellow square, medium black square number two, medium black square number one, and then the medium blue square. Block C is to the left of Block B. Block C contains two medium yellow squares (number two above number one) and a medium blue square at the bottom. The arrangement in Block C is: medium yellow square number two, medium yellow square number one, and then the medium blue square. We are asked which square is above a medium blue square: medium yellow square number one (in Block C) or the medium yellow square (in Block A). Medium yellow square number one is above the medium blue square in Block C. The question asks what is above *a* medium blue square, not a specific one. Since medium yellow square number one is above a medium blue square (the one in Block C) and the medium yellow square in Block A is also above a medium blue square (the one in Block B), the answer is both. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{C}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain invents a specific vertical stacking order for the objects within Block B, which contradicts the fragmented and relative positional information provided in the source text. This invented structure leads to an incorrect intermediate conclusion about what is above the blue square in Block B.

Full Question

Medium blue square number one is below the black object which is below medium black square number two. It is below the medium blue square number two. Block C contains one medium black square. (a) medium black square number one (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. Block A is below block B and it is above block C. Block A has two medium blue squares. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two and a medium black square. Medium blue square number two is below the medium black square. Block B contains two medium blue squares and two other medium black squares. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium blue square number two is below medium black square number two and medium black square number one. Below medium black square number two there is medium black square number one. Medium blue square number one is below the black object which is below medium black square number two. It is below the medium blue square number two. Block C contains one medium black square. Which object is below a medium black square? medium black square number one or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) medium black square number one (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A is below Block B and above Block C. In Block A, the medium blue square number two is below the medium black square, and medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two. Block B has medium blue square number one touching the bottom edge. Since Block C is below Block A and Block A has a medium black square, the object below the medium black square (in Block A) is the medium black square in Block C. Medium black square number one (in Block B) is below a medium black square (medium black square number two in Block B). Therefore, both medium black square number one and the medium black square in Block C are each below a medium black square. Thus, the answer is {C}. \boxed{c}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain makes two significant factual errors regarding the contents and location of the black squares, leading to an unsupported conclusion about the relationship between medium black square number one and the black square in Block C.

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are two blocks. Let's call them A and B. One medium blue square, a medium black square and a medium yellow square are in block A. Below the medium yellow square is the medium black square. The medium blue square is below the medium yellow square and the medium black square. Below block A is block B. It has three medium black squares. Below medium black square number three there is medium black square number one. Below medium black square number three is medium black square number two. There is also one medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium black square number one is the medium yellow square. This object is below medium black square number two and medium black square number three. Which object is below a blue object? the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow square that is in block A? (a) the medium yellow square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow square that is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: In block A, we have a medium yellow square, a medium black square, and a medium blue square. According to and , the order from top to bottom is: medium yellow square, then medium black square, and finally medium blue square. Below block A is block B, which contains three medium black squares and a medium yellow square touching the bottom edge. Since the question asks what is below the blue object (medium blue square), and the blue square is in Block A, while Block B is below Block A, the object below the blue object must be in Block B. The only yellow square below the blue square in the entire setting is the one touching the bottom of Block B, which is the medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of a block. Therefore, the answer is {a}. \boxed{a}
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly determines the vertical stacking order within Block A, leading to a flawed justification for selecting the final answer, even though the final selection might coincidentally align with the correct answer based on other constraints.

According to and , the order from top to bottom is: medium yellow square, then medium black square, and finally medium blue square.

The context does not explicitly state the order between the medium black square and the medium blue square, nor does it state the order is Yellow -> Black -> Blue.

Which object is below a medium blue square? medium black square number one or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) medium black square number one (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has two medium blue squares, with number two below a medium black square, and number one below square two. Block B (above A) has two medium blue squares and two medium black squares. Block C, below A, has one medium black square. Since we want what is below the medium blue squares, focusing on Block B, black square number one is below blue square number two. Block C and its black square are below Block A, which is below Block B. Therefore, the medium black square in Block C is not directly below a medium blue square. So only medium black square number one is directly below a blue square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}

This object is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the square which is below medium blue square number two. This shape is below medium blue square number two. Block C has one medium black square. Which object is below a medium blue square? the medium black square which is in block B or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) the medium black square which is in block B (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has two medium blue squares and medium blue square number one touches the bottom edge. Block B also has two medium blue squares, with a medium black square below medium blue square number two and medium blue square number one touching the bottom edge. Block C is below both Block A and B and contains a medium black square. Because Block C is below Block B, the medium black square in C is below medium blue square number one in Block B. Also, since the medium black square in B is below medium blue square number two, both medium black squares are below a medium blue square. Therefore, the answer is {C}.

Full Question

Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two. Below medium blue square number one , medium blue square number two and medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B is to the right of block A. It has a medium black square. A medium yellow square is below the medium black square. Finally, there is block C. It is to the right of block B. It has a medium black square and a medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Which object is to the left of a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or medium yellow square number two? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) medium yellow square number two (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There are two medium yellow squares and two other medium blue squares in block A. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Medium yellow square number two is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is below medium blue square number two. Below medium blue square number one , medium blue square number two and medium yellow square number two there is medium yellow square number one. Block B is to the right of block A. It has a medium black square. A medium yellow square is below the medium black square. Finally, there is block C. It is to the right of block B. It has a medium black square and a medium yellow square. The medium black square is below the medium yellow square. Which object is to the left of a medium black square? the medium yellow square that is in block C or medium yellow square number two? (a) the medium yellow square that is in block C (b) medium yellow square number two (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains two medium yellow squares (number one and number two) and two medium blue squares (number two above number one). Block B is to the right of Block A and contains a medium black square. Block C is to the right of Block B and contains a medium yellow square above a medium black square. We are looking for which object is to the left of a medium black square. Since Block A is to the left of Block B (which contains a medium black square), medium yellow square number two (which is in Block A) is to the left of the medium black square in Block B. The medium yellow square in Block C is not to the left of the medium black square; rather, it is in a block to the right of the medium black square. Therefore, only medium yellow square number two is to the left of the medium black square. Final Answer: \boxed{b}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies that medium yellow square number two (in Block A) is to the left of the black square in Block B. However, it fails to fully analyze the spatial relationship concerning the black square *in Block C* when evaluating option (a), leading to an incomplete analysis, although the final conclusion matches the correct answer based on the black square in Block B.

However, the reasoning then uses this structure to conclude the yellow square in C is NOT to the left of the black square in B, which is irrelevant to the question asked, which is 'Which object is to the left of *a* medium black square?' (implying any black square). The reasoning ignores the black square in C itself.

Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is below blocks B and A. Block A has two medium blue squares. A medium yellow square is also in this block. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square there is medium blue square number two. Below the medium yellow square and medium blue square number two there is medium blue square number one. Block B contains two medium blue squares. It also has a medium black square. This object is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the square which is below medium blue square number two. This shape is below medium blue square number two. Block C has one medium black square. Which object is below a medium blue square? the medium black square that is in block B or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) the medium black square that is in block B (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is below blocks B and A. Block A has two medium blue squares. A medium yellow square is also in this block. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium yellow square there is medium blue square number two. Below the medium yellow square and medium blue square number two there is medium blue square number one. Block B contains two medium blue squares. It also has a medium black square. This object is below medium blue square number two. Medium blue square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This shape is below the square which is below medium blue square number two. This shape is below medium blue square number two. Block C has one medium black square. Which object is below a medium blue square? the medium black square that is in block B or the medium black square that is in block C? (a) the medium black square that is in block B (b) the medium black square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has medium blue squares and a medium yellow square. Medium blue square number one is at the bottom edge of Block A. Block B has two medium blue squares and a medium black square. The black square is below medium blue square number two in Block B. Medium blue square number one is at the bottom edge of Block B. Block C, which is below Blocks A and B, contains a medium black square. We want to know which black square is below a medium blue square. Since the medium black square in Block B is below medium blue square number two, and Block C (containing the other black square) is below Block B, the answer is the medium black square in Block B. Because Block C is beneath Block B, the black square in C is below the blue squares in Block B, but not directly below any of them. The black square in Block B, however, is directly beneath a blue square in Block B. \boxed{(a)}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the components but misinterprets the exact positional relationship of the black square in Block B relative to the blue squares, leading to a factual inaccuracy in the reasoning chain, although the final conclusion might still align with the intended answer based on the available facts.

Explanation

The reasoning chain simplifies this to a direct 'below' relationship which is contradicted by the complex positional information given for the black square in B.

Full Question
We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There are two medium yellow squares in block A. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two which is below a medium blue square. It also contains one medium black square. Below the medium blue square and medium yellow square number one there is the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium blue square. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow square in it. Finally, we have block C to the right of block A and to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square and a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium black square that is in block C or the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium black square that is in block C (b) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There are two medium yellow squares in block A. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two which is below a medium blue square. It also contains one medium black square. Below the medium blue square and medium yellow square number one there is the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is below the medium blue square. Then, there is block B with one medium yellow square in it. Finally, we have block C to the right of block A and to the left of block B. It contains a medium yellow square and a medium black square. The medium yellow square is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium black square that is in block C or the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the medium black square that is in block C (b) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains two medium yellow squares (number one and number two), a medium blue square, and a medium black square. Block B contains a medium yellow square. Block C, which is to the right of Block A and to the left of Block B, contains a medium yellow square and a medium black square. The question asks what is to the right of a medium yellow square. Since Block C is to the right of Block A, and Block C contains a medium black square, the medium black square in Block C is to the right of the medium yellow squares in Block A. The medium black square in Block A is not to the right of any medium yellow square. Therefore, the answer is {A}. \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the contents of the blocks and uses the spatial relationship between Block A and Block C to partially answer the question. However, it fails to analyze the internal structure of Block A, leading to an unsupported conclusion about the black square in Block A, which is necessary to fully evaluate option (b).

Block B contains a big blue triangle, one medium black circle and one medium yellow square. The medium black circle is to the right of a small black square and the medium yellow square. It is touching the right edge of this block. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below and to the left of the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium yellow triangle, a medium black circle and a small yellow square. To the left of and above the small yellow square is the medium black circle. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. Below the medium black circle is the medium yellow triangle. Which object is above a medium black circle? the shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow triangle? (a) the shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. Block C is below blocks A and B. Block A contains one small yellow square. Block B contains a big blue triangle, one medium black circle and one medium yellow square. The medium black circle is to the right of a small black square and the medium yellow square. It is touching the right edge of this block. The small black square is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below and to the left of the medium yellow square. And block C contains one medium yellow triangle, a medium black circle and a small yellow square. To the left of and above the small yellow square is the medium black circle. The small yellow square is touching the right edge of this block. Below the medium black circle is the medium yellow triangle. Which object is above a medium black circle? the shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium yellow triangle? (a) the shape that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium yellow triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block C contains a medium yellow triangle, a medium black circle, and a small yellow square touching the right edge. The medium yellow triangle is below the medium black circle, and the small yellow square is also below and to the right of the medium black circle. Block B contains a medium black circle as well, and it sits above Block C. The small black square in Block B is touching the bottom edge, and it's to the left of the medium black circle. Since we're asked what's above the medium black circle in Block C, and Block B is above Block C, the shape above the medium black circle is the small black square. Since the small black square is the shape touching the bottom edge of Block B, the answer is {A}. The medium yellow triangle is below, not above, the medium black circle in Block C. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{A}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain incorrectly tries to determine the answer by analyzing the spatial relationship between Block B and Block C, which is not required by the question structure. It misinterprets the question, which asks which of the two provided options (a shape touching the bottom edge OR the medium yellow triangle) is above *a* medium black circle (implying the one in Block C, as the options relate to Block C's contents or general properties). The reasoning incorrectly concludes the answer based on an object in Block B being above Block C.

The reasoning uses the 'touching the bottom edge' fact to select option (a) without properly linking it to the question's required relationship (above a medium black circle).

Full Question

The big blue square is touching the left edge of this block.. The medium blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. It is above the big yellow square. It is below and to the right of the medium black square. Block B is below block A. It has a small black triangle and one small black square. To the right of the small black square there is the small black triangle. Finally, there is block C above block B. It has one small yellow square. It also has one medium blue triangle. The medium blue triangle is to the right of and below the small yellow square. Which object is below a small yellow square? the small black square or the medium blue triangle? (a) the small black square (b) the medium blue triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them

Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. We call them A, B and C. There are a medium blue circle, one big yellow square and one medium black square in block A. Below the medium black square which is to the right of a big blue square is the big yellow square. It is touching the right edge of this block. The big blue square is touching the left edge of this block.. The medium blue circle is touching the right edge of this block. It is above the big yellow square. It is below and to the right of the medium black square. Block B is below block A. It has a small black triangle and one small black square. To the right of the small black square there is the small black triangle. Finally, there is block C above block B. It has one small yellow square. It also has one medium blue triangle. The medium blue triangle is to the right of and below the small yellow square. Which object is below a small yellow square? the small black square or the medium blue triangle? (a) the small black square (b) the medium blue triangle (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains a medium blue circle, a big yellow square, and a medium black square. Block B (below Block A) has a small black triangle and a small black square. Block C (above Block B) has a small yellow square and a medium blue triangle. The question asks what is below the small yellow square. Since Block C is above Block B, and the small yellow square is in Block C, anything below it must be in Block B. Block B contains the small black square and small black triangle. Thus, the small black square is below the small yellow square, while the medium blue triangle is in the same block (Block C) as the small yellow square but to its right and below. The medium blue triangle cannot be below the small yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: fair
The reasoning correctly identifies the contents of the blocks and correctly deduces that anything below the small yellow square (in Block C) must be in Block B. However, it incorrectly dismisses the medium blue triangle as being below the small yellow square, contradicting the explicit positional information given in the context for those two objects within Block C.

(a) the medium blue square that is in block A (b) the medium blue square that is in block C (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B contains a medium black square, which is located below a medium blue square and above a medium yellow square. Full Question
We have three blocks, A, B and C. Two medium yellow squares are in block A. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two and medium yellow square number one is the medium blue square. Then, we have block B. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below medium black square number two and a medium blue square. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number two there is the medium blue square. To the right of both blocks A and B there is block C. It contains one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? the medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square that is in block B? (a) the medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
2
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: We have three blocks, A, B and C. Two medium yellow squares are in block A. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. There is also a medium blue square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium yellow square number two and medium yellow square number one is the medium blue square. Then, we have block B. It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below medium black square number two and a medium blue square. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number two there is the medium blue square. To the right of both blocks A and B there is block C. It contains one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? the medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square that is in block B? (a) the medium blue square which is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square that is in block B (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A contains two medium yellow squares and a medium blue square touching the bottom edge. Block B contains two medium black squares and a medium blue square. Block C is to the right of both Block A and Block B and contains a medium blue square. Since Block C is to the right of Block B and Block A, the objects in Block A and Block B are to the left of the medium blue square in Block C. Therefore, both the medium blue square touching the bottom edge of Block A and the medium blue square in Block B are to the left of the medium blue square in Block C. Both and meet the condition. Final Answer: \boxed{C}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the objects in each block and uses the spatial relationship (Block C being to the right of A and B) to deduce that objects in A and B are to the left of the blue square in C. The reasoning correctly addresses the question about which blue square has something to its left.

To the left of block A is block B. It has two small black circles. A big yellow triangle is touching the bottom edge of this block. This block also has a small yellow square. It also has one small black triangle and a medium blue circle. To the left of the medium blue circle is the small black triangle. Below the small yellow square there is the big yellow triangle. To the left of and below the small yellow square there is the small black triangle.. The medium blue circle is above small black circle number two.
