Below the medium blue square there is the medium yellow square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the blue thing or the black thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the blue thing (b) the black thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
0
Generated Answer
**Reformatted Question:** There are three blocks, A, B, and C. Two medium yellow squares are in block A. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below medium yellow square number two. Then, we have block B with two medium yellow squares in it. A medium black square is also touching the bottom edge of this block. The medium black square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. Finally, to the right of block A we have block C. It is to the right of block B. It contains one medium blue square. There is also one medium yellow square touching the bottom edge of this block. Below the medium blue square there is the medium yellow square. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the blue thing or the black thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) the blue thing (b) the black thing which is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them **Answer:** Block A contains two medium yellow squares. Block B also contains two medium yellow squares. Block C is to the right of Block A and to the right of Block B, and it contains a medium blue square. Because Block C is to the right of Block A (which has medium yellow squares), the blue square is to the right of a medium yellow square. So the blue thing is to the right of a medium yellow square. Similarly, since Block C is also to the right of Block B (which also contains medium yellow squares), the blue square is also to the right of medium yellow squares in Block B. Block B contains a black square touching the bottom edge, but it is not to the right of any medium yellow square in Block B, but below it. So the black thing is not to the right of a medium yellow square. Final Answer: \boxed{A}
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relative positions of the blocks and the objects within them to answer the question about which object is to the right of a medium yellow square. It correctly concludes that the blue thing is to the right of a medium yellow square (in Block C relative to Block A/B), and the black thing is not to the right of a medium yellow square.

It contains two medium black squares. Medium black square number one is below medium black square number two and a medium blue square. Medium black square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. Below medium black square number two there is the medium blue square. To the right of both blocks A and B there is block C. It contains one medium blue square. Which object is to the left of a medium blue square? medium black square number two or the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block? (a) medium black square number two (b) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block B has two medium black squares: number two and number one (touching the bottom edge), as well as a medium blue square. Medium black square number two is above the medium blue square, and medium black square number one is below both of them. Block C is to the right of Block B. Since medium black square number two is to the left of the blue square in block B, the answer is {A}. Medium black square number one is also to the left of the medium blue square in block C, but isn't to the left of a medium blue square in block B. The answer is medium black square number two. \boxed{A}

Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square? Reformatted Question: We have three blocks. Let's call them A, B and C. A medium yellow square is in block A. To the right of block A there is block B with two medium yellow squares in it. Below medium yellow square number two and medium yellow square number one there is a medium blue square. The medium black square is below medium yellow square number one and medium yellow square number two. Finally, there is block C to the left of block B. It contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. This object is below medium yellow square number two. Which object is to the right of a medium yellow square? the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block or the medium blue square? (a) the medium black square that is touching the bottom edge of a block (b) the medium blue square (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A has a medium yellow square. Block B is to the right of Block A and contains two medium yellow squares, a medium black square touching the bottom edge, and a medium blue square below the yellow squares. This includes both the medium black square touching the bottom edge and the medium blue square. Therefore, both are to the right of the medium yellow square in Block A. \boxed{C}

Explanation

The context describes their relative positions to the yellow squares, which are in Block A and B.
Answer Span:

Reference/Question Span:

missing_context high
Statement
We want to know what's to the right of a medium yellow square (the one in Block A).
Explanation
The question asks which object is to the right of *a* medium yellow square, but the reasoning chain arbitrarily focuses only on the yellow square in Block A, ignoring the other yellow squares mentioned (two in B, two in C, and the numbered ones). This omission affects the completeness of the reasoning.
Answer Span:
We want to know what's to the right of a medium yellow square (the one in Block A).
Reference/Question Span:
Medium yellow square number one is below medium yellow square number two. . . It contains two medium yellow squares. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block.
Question #3555
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A is to the left of B and block B is below C. Block A has two medium yellow squares. One medium black square is also in this block. Medium yell...
Clean
Full Question
There are three blocks. Lets call them A, B and C. Block A is to the left of B and block B is below C. Block A has two medium yellow squares. One medium black square is also in this block. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium black square.. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number two. Block B contains one medium blue square. And block C contains three medium black squares. Below medium black square number two and a medium yellow square is medium black square number one. Below the medium yellow square and medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below the medium yellow square there is medium black square number three. Which object is to the left of a blue shape? medium black square number three or the medium black square which is in block A? (a) medium black square number three (b) the medium black square which is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them
Ground Truth Answer
1
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: There are three blocks. Let's call them A, B, and C. Block A is to the left of B and block B is below C. Block A has two medium yellow squares. One medium black square is also in this block. Medium yellow square number two is below the medium black square. Medium yellow square number one is touching the bottom edge of this block. It is below the medium black square and medium yellow square number two. Block B contains one medium blue square. And block C contains three medium black squares. Below medium black square number two and a medium yellow square is medium black square number one. Below the medium yellow square and medium black square number three is medium black square number two. Below the medium yellow square there is medium black square number three. Which object is to the left of a blue shape? medium black square number three or the medium black square which is in block A? (a) medium black square number three (b) the medium black square which is in block A (c) both of them (d) none of them Answer: Block A is to the left of Block B. Block B contains a medium blue square. Block A contains two medium yellow squares and one medium black square. Block C contains three medium black squares. We want to know what is to the left of the medium blue square in Block B. Since Block A is to the left of Block B, the medium black square in Block A is to the left of the medium blue square. The three medium black squares in Block C are arranged vertically and Block B is below Block C, so the medium black squares in Block C are not to the left of the medium blue square. Therefore, only the medium black square in Block A is to the left of the medium blue square. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{B}$
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the spatial relationships provided in the context (A is left of B, B is below C) and uses this to answer the question about what is to the left of the blue shape (in B). It correctly concludes that the object in A is to the left of the object in B, and objects in C are not relevant to being 'to the left' of B based on the given constraints.
